_IkfRSYohhJZ3N6zE2JwmQ.text: Phenomenal food & service! The banana cream pie was specifically recommended by a coworker and it lived up to the hype.

h4UfMb1c0MkA49V7A48ZdQ.text: I'm so happy we chose Eleven for a family get together over the holidays.! We had 9 people and the staff did an amazing job.  The food was fabulous and everyone enjoyed their meal.  The fish is so fresh and portions are just right. The wine list is awesome for any price range.  We loved the private room upstairs and I'm sure we'll be back!!

uSNo9psW4G7VLJv6T25luw.text: Eleven is good and I want to like it even more. I'm going to come back and review after a few additional visits. I typically order appetizers at the bar (group food) that are very good. However, this place smells like sewer gas as soon as you walk in. I'm not giving up yet!  ***Updated May 2018  If you're vegan, prepare to eat salad. There's not much on the menu for you, but the chef is willing to accommodate. I love salad so this doesn't bother me. If you're gluten free and vegan...eat before you go as you won't even be able to pick at bread. The salad portion isn't very large and I suggest requesting extra veggies.

I4uM33q2XgiGpXZ-NCk4BQ.text: Awesome bread, awesome oysters, awesome wine list and excellent bar drinks. Service was great. Would visit more often if I had more money (quite expensive).

i5TT2xdpTkozA2OcAPCqZw.text: I can't stop thinking about the crab cake. Amazing service and delicious food and drinks. Favorite restaurant in Pittsburgh.

zb6v6sxPkN585Ls037LUXw.text: What a great place for my beau and I to spend our 3rd anniversary together!   We came here (upon months of my insistence) for a lovely Sunday brunch and boy, was it everything I had hoped for and more! We both got the prix fixe at $25 each, which really ended up being a decent deal considering it included an appetizer, entree, and brunch cocktail. I wound up with the White Sangria, a refreshingly light concoction of chardonnay/plum wines, cucumber, fruit, and rum. Absolutely amazing in the heat of summer! The mimosa was also quite good, but fairly basic.  My appetizer of choice brought me back dahn south! I ordered the beignets, tenderly topped with rose and blueberries. The presentation and idea were perfect, but I felt it could have been just a bit more flavorful. The boyfriend got the grilled sticky, sans bacon (for us plant-eaters here), which ended up being amazing. I'm sure it would have been just as good without our minor change, since sweet + salty = tastebud heaven.  And the entree - mine the Eggs Benedict and my boyfriend's the Ratatouille and Goat Cheese Omelet. Both were deeeelicious. The Eggs Benedict was lightly drizzled with black truffle atop an english muffin with a side salad of sliced mandarin oranges and mint. While my dish was fairly simple, it was just so perfect and satiating! No crazy frills here - just a well-done entree. I had a taste of the omelet as well, which was equally as good. The mildness of the vegetables was offset by the rich and sour goat cheese, which acted as a perfect complement. I also couldn't stop stealing fingerling potatoes from my dining partner's plate! (Yes, there was a "potato tax" of 3 pieces every time he left for the bathroom or turned around.)  All in all, a great place! Service was professional and polite and the venue itself was light-filled and spacious. I can't wait to go back again!

AiBdumVNUnocbdX8S4MbvQ.text: Quite the delicious place! This was the best meal I had on my recent visit to Pittsburgh. We went with a large group of friends (which they easily accomodated) for brunch.  First of all, the service was excellent. Top notch. My biggest pet peeve is being thirsty and my drink was never empty! The waiter made some excellent suggestions. They brought out a perfect bread basket for starters - croissants, biscuits, muffins, a bit of every thing. The appetizers looked phenomenal. I had a bit of the egg toast and it was to die for. For my main course, I had the veal burger. Everything about it was perfect... It took all the manners I have to not devour it as soon as I tried the first bite. Perfectly done.  The ambiance was great, too. We were in a nook room on the second floor, which was great for a bit of privacy.  I also like that they were high end food, but had some options for the youngsters. They had a few menu options for kids, making it a great place for a family get together.  Definitely a win from this trip. Can't wait to go back!

3lPv660sNLIQDT5CWhKfNw.text: Loved this place, we went here for dinner before my friends bachelorette party and it was the perfect place...I got chicken and risotto and it was absolutely amazing and the banana cream pie that we had for dessert was perfect. Combined with the awesome waiter and the amazing atmosphere I'll definitely be going back soon!

-F26yT-K9PwAsRba4OrUgA.text: ***Eleven's food is not exceptionally creative or original, but the food here is good, fresh and reasonably priced for an upscale lunch***  Eleven is part of the Big Burrito group, which has many notable restaurants in Pittsburgh.  This one is an upscale spot next to the John Heinz History Center.  The restaurant has a nice contemporary decor.  There is a slightly open kitchen.  The main dining room makes a good use of green and there is comfortable seating along with white tablecloth.  The room also has high ceilings.  In some ways, the room reminds me a little of a cross between Tavern and Lucques (though Eleven lacks the inside-and-outside like atmosphere of Tavern).  Eleven's lunch menu is very inviting.  There is a great collection of starters--some nice sounding salads but also scallops and crab cakes.  Their entree section features a mix of gourmet sandwiches and burgers as well as plates with proteins like lamb and fish.  The bread at Eleven was standard stuff--not much of a crust, not much of a chew and even a little bit dry.  My starter was good.  I had the seared scallops, which were garnished with fingerling potatoes, pearl onions, spinach, sorrel, and sauce gribiche.  It was a very generous portion for a lunch starter.  I thought it was good.  Everything tasted fine and a lot of the ingredients were good.  The scallops were nicely seasoned and had a good outside crust.  They were tender, but the scallops lacked the moistness of the scallops at Lola.  I liked the pearl onions and I thought the sauce gribiche was briny, sour and good.  I also liked the spinach.  The fingerling potatoes were too big.  They were not bland and definitely not raw, but the insides of the potatoes were not as tender as they should have been (4 stars for this dish).  For my entree, I had the Elysian Fields Farm lamb t-bones with a salad of radicchio, arugula, endive, fingerling potatoes, and idiazabal cheese.  Elysian Fields Farm is a great producer of lamb (the farm is located just an hour outside of Pittsburgh).  I once had their lamb at Sona and it was exceptional there (they also provide lamb to The French Laundry).  The lamb here was good.  The lamb was like little porterhouse steaks.  There was a New York strip part that was flavorful and juicy but also with a chew and less tender texture than the filet mignon-like portion, which was very tender.  There were two t-bones and they were a tad uneven.  One was seasoned a little too heavily while the other was not as juicy as I wanted.  Still, the lamb t-bones were flavorful and good.  The salad was a very bitter salad with the radicchio, arugula and fennel.  I did not mind the bitterness, but I think some would.  I liked the cheese and they did a better job with the fingerling potatoes here, which were sliced and tender (3 stars for this entree).  For dessert, I had the chocolate-peanut pretzel candy bar, which was surprisingly  good.  The base of the candy bar was a decent though not great brownie.  There was a very good and creamy peanut butter mousse as well as a thin layer of a dark chocolate bar.  There was a decent chocolate ice cream on top as well as peanut brittle and very good pretzel nuggets that were topped with smooth melted chocolate.  There was also a caramel sauce.  The dessert tasted pretty good and while there were a lot of sweet and rich elements, the dessert did not get too rich or too sweet (4 stars for this dessert).  The meal ended with a coconut macaroon, which was mediocre and dry.  Service was good.  My server was pleasant, personable, polite, and attentive.  The food came out at a good pace.  Prices were about what you would expect to pay for an upscale lunch.  When considering the many high quality and premium ingredients used, this lunch at Eleven was probably a little less expensive than equivalent places in LA.  I liked my lunch at Eleven.  While the food was not exceptional, my starter, entree and dessert were all at the very least good.  The food was not really creative or exciting enough to make me want to come back, but I think this is a good option for an upscale lunch in Pittsburgh (they had a pretty good lunch crowd on the day I went).  There are several metered spots along Smallman Street.  There is also a paid lot for the Heinz History Center, which is $5 per day.

MwfUT9xfBwYdL64JBbKlFw.text: I was very excited to take my girlfriend to Eleven in the Strip District for a romantic Saturday date-night. As a part time Uber driver I had the pleasure of driving a member of Eleven's staff a few weeks ago (Jennifer). We spoke about the restaurant and the food selections and I definitely put it on my list of must try's in Pittsburgh. Due to a busy schedule I had to reschedule our reservation for a Saturday a week after our original date. This was done seamlessly through the OpenTable app which I've used plenty of times. I had the car valeted and the valet staff was very nice, upon entering I immediately got a bad vibe from the host at the kiosk. I was given a smile but the large 6'0"+ guy at the kiosk didn't seem very genuine in his greeting. Oh well I thought, let's get seated.   Our table was nicely positioned in the back which I liked, private. Our waiter, a gentleman in his late 30's/early 40s with a brown/reddish beard greeted us. Immediately I could tell he was both apathetic and in a rush to get us out of there. He made minimal eye contact with me and his answers to my questions seemed rushed and short. We ordered a full dinner complete with drinks, appetizer, entrees and desert. At no point did our server seem interested in our experience as he looked over us at other tables with disinterest. We were both dressed nicely in business casual attire and I was hoping to make this a special experience but instead felt insulted. My girlfriend even asked me several times if I was okay or if something was wrong although I didn't disclose my disappointment until days later for her sake. We were one of the youngest couples in the establishment and in my opinion it was either age related or the fact that we weren't dressed up "enough" as some men had jackets on but I noticed others did not.   Awful service on an otherwise incredible food experience. This was an expensive dinner but will most likely be my last time bringing my business here.

il9IzPHi4ADraIi-Vxnpow.text: A modern American bistro of note in Pittsburgh.   My partner and I visited for a luncheon after spending the morning at the Andy Warhol Museum. If I remember correctly, the walk from the museum to their location on Smallman Street, took around ten minutes. The stroll is lovely - you'll cross over one of the bridges offering impressive views of the cityscape.  An amusing duck breast salad, was followed by a vegetable cavatelli pasta main dish. Both dishes displayed very clean, honest, and fresh flavours. Service was professional - the best I experienced in Pittsburgh - as my waiter anticipated all of my needs quickly and effortlessly. Decor was uplifting, with high ceilings in the main dining room where we were seated. Wine list was one of the best I laid my eyes on in Pittsburgh, too. Many good bottles to choose from in all price points.

photos.caption: Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Perfect pasta for lunch.
Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Duck ham salad.

fJmMp62tlRwEJMV8YRJ7zA.text: Eleven is a beautiful restaurant. It has a sophisticated design I really liked and a big plus were the spacious tables/booths so that you never feel cramped. Service was generally on-point but nothing extraordinary. They forgot to fill my dad's water glass and I wish they explained the wine pairings with the courses in more detail rather than just state what type of wine it was and where it was from.  The food was good but inconsistent. I tried the four-course tasting menu with wine pairings and was overall pleased, but also a bit disappointed. The proscuitto and egg appetizer was a great start and was really well balanced. The egg was cooked perfectly with a great runny yolk. The proscuitto added much needed saltiness to the dish while a touch of balsamic gave a nice hint of acid.  Unfortunately, things went downhill from there. The second course was a pan-seared bass that was good, but not particularly memorable. The third course was a lamb loin chop that I was really excited for (especially after reading reviews about it here on Yelp), but ultimately fell flat due to errors in cooking. I ordered the lamb medium-rare but was served a well-done piece. I had to send it back, and the next lamb I got was medium bordering on medium-well. I didn't feel like sending it back a second time, so I just dealt with it. It was seasoned well and I could see the great potential of the dish, but I couldn't really enjoy it since it was overcooked.  I am glad to say that desserts are well done here and are HUGE. The tiramisu cannolis were great and not as rich as I expected (which is a good thing). The hazelnuts were a nice touch. The chocolate-peanut-pretzel candy bar was delicious, but be warned... It's really sweet and heavy.  I also got to try the oysters (very fresh) and the crab cake. The crab cake was just fantastic and full of crab meat. It was one of the best I've ever had.  Eleven is a solid restaurant that I would recommend even though I wanted it to be even better. I just hope that the cooking becomes more consistent in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pan-seared bass
Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Foie gras
Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Prosciutto and egg

ey3Wi0VNnsbd3vFal3VCqw.text: Eleven was very good I must say, but nothing I had was '5 star' amazing. I'll say 4.5 stars.  Let's start with the appetizers. I had the scallops and my girlfriend had the ricotta cavatelli. Both were great, my scallops were wrapped in crispy potatoes and came in a bowl over some ham and bean stew. The stew may have been the best thing we had all night! Shame there were only a few spoonfuls. The cavatelli was also good and was served with roasted red peppers and fresh ricotta and lemon. The lemon was a bit overpowering with the red peppers for my taste, but my girlfriend enjoyed it, and when she's happy I'm happy!  I forgot to mention the bread - they brought around a sampling of breads including sea salt foccacia, semolina, and a raisin bread. All were good, the foccacia was our favorite.  For our main courses I had the pork chop while my girlfriend had the Gnocchi. Both were great. The pork chop was huge! It came with a small bit of apple sauce that was delectable when combined with a bite of pork. The Gnocchi had all sorts of good stuff in it including brussel sprout leaves crispy prosciutto and parsnips. We somehow ate everything!  It was my girlfriend's birthday so we decided to get dessert. I got the tiramisu cannoli and she got the chocolate-peanut-pretzel candy bar. They were ok, we were so full from dinner it was hard to eat everything. There was part of of her 'candy bar' that was a house made 'crunch' bar with milk chocolate and crispy something (rice?). I was fascinated with that I tried to get the waiter to tell me how to make it!   Overall I give Eleven four and a half stars, it seemed a bit pricey for what we got, but I'm not complaining. All the food was delicious and the wait staff were very knowledgeable about the menu and wine list. I now compare every restaurant to 'Salt of the Earth' because the meal I had there is the best I've had in Pittsburgh, so if Salt is 5 stars, this must fall underneath that. I wish there was an option for 4.5 stars but alas there isn't, or maybe I'm just incompetent at yelping. Give Eleven a try! I think next time I go there will be for lunch so I can get my hands on that delicious looking 'Eleven Burger'

photos.caption: Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tiramisu Cannoli
Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pork Chop with Carolina gold rice, black-eyed peas, pork belly, turnips, roasted shallots, kale, and apple sauce
Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sea Scallops, potato-wrapped, with white bean &amp; ham hock stew, melted leeks, and chervil

CrIxlimzRjlM94-iI8dnUg.text: My fiance and I had the beef tenderloin and steak. It was amazing!! So flavorful. Costs are what u expect from a higher end restaurant but I was happy with the quality and food portion.

eOyoq-ML8xHEDvpanrNYJg.text: This is probably the nicest restaurant in town with choices of indoor or outdoor seating. Plush interior, and cute little upstairs dining with open air style seating. We had several dishes and everything had the most wonderful flavors, cooked to perfection. Staff seems to be attentive and food was so tasty! Every morsel was enjoyed. If you are wondering if this is the place for dinner I have two words for you! Do it!

4jhfgGtYnl5VvRJkz0aAQg.text: I had lunch at Eleven while on a  business trip to Pittsburgh. I loved the stylish seagreen decor with iron accents. Even better, the food at Eleven was outstanding and I thoroughly enjoyed my grilled swordfish which was served atop a bed of couscous and a chunky tomato caper sauce. For dessert, I had a slice of poppyseed angelfood cake which was flavorful and nicely complimented by a dollop of homemade citrus curd. Last of all, the service was thoughtful, efficient and friendly.  What a lovely place! I'd happily return.

cenFa_twa7viYzCqb4-fWQ.text: eleven is one of the best dining experiences I have ever had. My boyfriend and I had the chefs menu for that evening, and the wine pairing. Delicious, and also a great wait staff! Can't wait to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Best flourless chocolate cake I&#39;ve ever had!
Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Coffee, perfect set up.

Kd1OK7vo5pFt43lpVANXzw.text: Came here for dinner and drinks before a show downtown and sat in the bar. Our server spilled water on my friend from the plate of oysters, and I ordered a sandwich to come out after our appetizers. The sandwich didn't come and didn't come, and by the time we could flag down our water I had to get it to go. Which is too bad, because it was really delicious. He apologized but um, still had to eat my sandwich while walking on my way to Heinz Hall. Good food, bad service!

a8ZjEaSGYBWls-bXQRBiOg.text: It's reputation speaks for itself, but I"ll give an extra shout out for the awesome brunch I had yesterday.  The zucchini, mushroom and goat cheese omelet was outstanding, and the portions were well worth the price.  The prix fixe brunch option offers a choice of appetizer, entree, and cocktail or juice beverage for $29...and I had more than enough leftover to take some home.  The grilled stickies are out of this world...it was the perfect balance of salty and sweet.  An overall fantastic experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Zucchini, mushroom, and goat cheese omelet.  Fantastic.

McVM4T_wWLL8Yxq-Par43g.text: Really good food!  I had the beet salad - small plate but large rich taste.   I also had the tuna tartare, which was delicious.   Definitely recommend this spot!

GsQP3NaQBvmBknMp-uxtyg.text: This review is based on the absolute worst new years eve dinner ever. Honestly, not one dish clicked; only the drinks saved the evening. Too much effort was spent trying to complicate the menu vs delivering solid food. For instance, no one at the table could dare eat the short ribs due to the horrid taste and excess fat. Another seafood dish was served cold but definitely needed heat. For a party of four with a bill well over $$$$$$, it was definitely not worth it! Alas, I will try to revisit my review in the next couple weeks as I travel back to the Burgh and try the normal menu based on a friend's recommendation.

5PbRVZY1q3HaaQn5pLDM9A.text: I was in Pittsburgh alone for work.  Though hell apparently froze over (it was first week of Feb), I did not want to be imprisoned in my hotel room so I yelped for the nearest well-reviewed place to take my taste buds.  At first I thought it'd be close enough to just walk to.  Silly California girl that I am.  As soon as I stepped out onto the hotel driveway, I slipped on ice.  In front of bumper to bumper traffic.  Sad FACE!  I immediately scrapped that idea and hopped into the nearest cab for a 5 minute ride.    After making it safely (relatively) to the restaurant, I was immediately seated (I was having an early dinner).  The host was a little snooty but it is that kind of place and I was very underdressed.  My waiter, on the other hand, was super nice and... super happy. Maybe it's the Californian negativity but I was kind of caught off-guard by his excitement. Still, I appreciated his attitude, especially after the weird looks I kept getting from the host.  I knew what I wanted to order as soon as I sat down (that's because I had examined the menu online an hour before) - seared foie gras (duh!) and the Eleven burger.  The foie gras was excellent and generous but the burger was huge (no complaints there) and really salty.  I'm not sure whether it was the veal or the bacon that was salty but it was over-seasoned.    Overall, great ambiance, good (not great) food, and good service.  Pretty impressed.

0oPW1KWI94SnuKkVSSdMWQ.text: The food and drinks were good. Great location. Good service. I knocked a star down because I wasn't super fond of the environment, for some reason I didn't find it very comfortable.

_5gQLvnZeqFqX3TqS4gzwg.text: I wanted to love Eleven.  I really did.  This really should be a 2.5 star review.  Ate there two years ago and remember a gorgeous pork chop, cooked perfectly.  I came back in October 2011 with very high expectations.  Alas, I was somewhat disappointed.  The space itself is nice - quirky and intimate.  The service is polished and knowledgeable.  The cooking is hit or miss.  I started with the cider glazed plums with gorgonzola and speck.  A nice idea in theory, but I found this dish to be very harshly flavored.  The glaze was extremely acidic - almost astringently so.  The speck was good, but the gorgonzola should have been a sweeter version thereof.  I found it too harsh with the plums, a combination that I would have otherwise thought perfect.    My entree was the Jameson lamb done three or four ways - lamb saddle roasted and sliced, lamb bacon and some other slow roasted cut that fell apart like carnitas.  The lamb was nicely cooked and presented, the beets and potatoes perfectly cooked.  The red onion marmalade was, to reuse a word, astringent.  It caused heartburn soon after I left the restaurant, and I only had a couple of bites.  Does the chef taste his sauces?  Maybe not, based on my recent dinner there.  Had an unmemorable deconstructed banana cream dessert.  Meh.  For the money, I am sure one can do better in Pittsburgh.  I know I will try someplace else next time I am in town. Very disappointing.

photos.caption: Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

TMRP-BiAf726odFtCEz63g.text: Based on the reviews on Yelp, we decided to try Eleven this morning for brunch. We weren't greeted with a very warm welcome to start, and we were almost seated on the restaurant side but our table seemed a little close to the kitchen (open kitchen concept), so we opted to sit in the bar. The dated couches and decor in the bar seemed like it was due for a remodel, but we wanted to give the place a shot anyway. Our service was overall pretty lack luster, we had a few questions about the menu that either couldn't be answered or were answered quickly with a somewhat short response.. We opted to get the price fixe that included a cocktail, appetizer and dessert. The pastries they brought out were great, although the biscuits were a touch dry/overcooked. Both my husband and I thought our food was mediocre for what we paying, and my steak with the crispy farm egg (egg was delicious and great!) was very overcooked.. Our bartender (didn't mention name) was busy chatting at the other end of the bar, so we sadly didn't order another bloody mary (which was also very good).  Overall we just didn't feel as comfortable as we would've hoped for dining in a nicer establishment like Eleven.. The food was okay, and the place has potential, it just fell short in a few key areas.

SnctmQzqPxXDfoXkeg9rgg.text: Really amazing food, excellent service, knowledgeable well trained staff, creative chef.  There is a lot of attention to detail at Eleven, all the way from the food preparation to the delivery.  The staff is thoughtful and well trained.  The food is delicious.  Don't forget Eleven has a great brunch menu, too.  Yes, the prices are expensive, but this restaurant is a great choice for a special occasion.

xl-xW2ofFs1rMBkN--PsFQ.text: Eleven is one of my favorite restaurants in pittsburgh.  This restaurant exudes casual elegance without giving you that desperate "You are eating in a fine dining establishment!" feeling.  I dont really know what that means either, but you'll understand if you have been there.  It's beautiful inside, but its also comfortable and welcoming.  You will need a reservation to dine at Eleven, and once you are there you will want to wait in the bar area and have a cocktail if you are able to.  The mixed drinks are all excellent.  Don't dine here if you are in a hurry!  Eating at Eleven is an experience and your dinner will probably take about an hour and a half.  One of my favorite things about Eleven is their bread basket, I believe they make the bread in house.  I highly recommend the beet salad and the Seafood Tasting.  It's incredible.  The food there is consistently fantastic.  I sound like a desperate girl describing all the things she likes about her crush.  I have a crush on Eleven.  I'm not ashamed.  There is only one menu item I wouldn't avoid again, and that was the steak.  It was over $40 and it was good, but my mind was not blown.  You can get a steak anywhere, order something else.  Eleven is not one of those restaurants that will leave both you and your wallet starving.  I never have room to order the desserts but they look fantastic.  This is a perfect restaurant to take a date, a business client, your parents from out of town, or to just have dinner w/ your friends.  This restaurant is good if you have a large party--call ahead and see if you can't reserve one of the dinings rooms.  My friend had her birthday party there and we had excellent service in the dining room.  If you consider yourself a foodie, and you're from PIttsburgh and have not been to Eleven yet you need to realize that this is an Epic Fail, and make reservations for Eleven NOW.

lOR_VEct0H90-p_UWRrLQQ.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants. It feels like an experience, not just a meal here. They make their own break and have a person delivering it around, you have several choices usually. Some highlights are as follows: -the oysters are great. They serve two sauces, one which is a bit spicy, and it really adds to the oyster flavor.  -they had sea scallops wrapped in a crispy, stringed potato. It was resting in black beans and had prosciutto on top. It may have been the best thing I've ever tasted.  -ordered the kale salad. I normally don't care for kale, but it worked well with the oil dressing and light Parmesan shredded on top of it. -had the New York strip rare. The steak was seasoned and seared extremely well. It was served with Parmesan potato tots that made me drop and F bomb they were so good. The outside was crispy, the inside was smooth like they somehow figured how to mash a potato and coat it in a crispy potato outside.  -they change their menu through the seasons, so if you check out their menu online, don't be surprised if you show up and the menu is a bit different. Nothing major, but I've gone with people expecting to see certain dishes after seeing them on their website, but then being disappointed to see that it wasn't being served. Regardless, I was never unhappy with a meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Their strip steak. It was pretty awesome

i8AHc-lAMT7iqaU8xLT-2w.text: Worth the hype. Unfortunately, they don't offer tasting menus anymore, but I was pleased by the variety on their menu this weekend. Everything about the restaurant was impeccable, from the food to the service to the ambiance.  We ordered two appetizers - the raw tuna and the scallops. I loved the scallops - and I order scallops at any place that has them on the menu, so I like to think that I know what's good :) The accompaniments to both appetizers were balanced and well done. For our entrees, I don't even remember what we ordered - my boyfriend got some chicken dish, and I got the fish. Both were very good - the usual balanced, delicate flavors and varied textures.   Dessert was divine and deserves its own shout-out. The banana cream pie was unique and light, while the creme fraiche creme brulee was more "normal" but still an elevated kind of average.

fGSQgWmvcMqjekTkQD2O7g.text: Yum. What a delicious brunch! I went here with a monthly brunch club and I think we were all satisfied with our decision to come to Eleven! I had the gnocchi with Brussels sprouts and pancetta. It was delicious. The Brussels sprouts were sliced and the pancetta was cubed and there was a nice amount of gnocchi covered in a nice well seasoned sauce that has a little bit of kick. I was also able to try the beignets which were fried dough puffs coated in powdered sugar. They were good and reminded me of funnel cake. Other guests had the yogurt and granola which looked super yummy. A few healthy dollops of thick creamy yogurt topped with coconut almost granola with mint, apple, and pomegranate.   The table was also served a basket of croissants and muffins with butter and apple jam on the side. The croissants were super flakey and I had a hard time not making a total mess! The mess was worth it though for that flaky goodness.   Appetizers for brunch are $9, entrees are $15, and brunch mixed drinks are $9. You can get their Prix Fixe and enjoy one of each for $25.

photos.caption: Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Gnocchi with pancetta and brussels sprouts from the brunch menu

mY_-QKJkStLfY79DW93JZA.text: Service was great, as were the dozen oysters. The mignonette was superb. However, my lamb entree was overcooked, and my wife's roasted chicken and her gnocchi appetizer were inedibly over-salted. The white asparagus soup was bland and uninventive. In addition, we had a hard time enjoying ourselves over the sound of whom I presume was the chef cursing and yelling at the kitchen staff. Finally, the decor is hopelessly outdated now. Perhaps in 2005 it was state of the art, but it'd be nice if someone realized a decade and a half has passed since then. 2/5 overall, and we will not be trying again. Hard to understand how this establishment was voted one of the best restaurants in Pittsburgh. For better, more creative food at a better price point with stylish and contemporary decor, I'd recommend avoiding downtown and the Strip and instead looking at some of the up-and-coming places in the East End and South Side.

58fuvb4W7f5h3YSbXByjDw.text: Have you really looked forward to something and then got disappointed? That was mine and my fiance's experience here at Eleven. We went for lunch, so dinner could be a different experience.   Food: 3.5/5. The food was pretty good. It was quality, but it just wasn't "top restaurant in the city" kind of quality. I got the swordfish sandwich, and my fiance got the scallops. The swordfish sandwich came with a salad that was on point. Did not meet our expectations, though. Barely worth the price.  Atmosphere: 1/5. Yikes. This was bad. First of all, there was no music playing. My fiance and I were basically whispering because we could hear everyone's conversations in the entire room. That was weird. The most frustrating part about my entire visit was when I went to the men's restroom. There were PICTURES OF COMPLETELY NAKED WOMEN IN EROTIC POSES ALL OVER THE PLACE. Why! Just why. I get it, it's art or whatever, but the line of art and "too much" was crossed. Regardless, the fact that the men's restroom was covered in naked women feeds into the stereotype that all men love to see naked women. This really saddened me. Worst part of the trip. Bathroom art is the platform for a restaurant to speak its values; sometimes you will find pictures of the city skyline or nature or seasonal pictures. This destroyed my view of Eleven, and the reason why I am never going back. The architecture was cool though (I'm trying to stay positive).  Service: 5/5. The server we had was great. Susan was awesome and super nice. She was down to earth, and wanted to have a conversation, but also respected our personal time/space. One of the best servers I have ever had at a restaurant. (Give her a raise, Eleven).  For those who are wondering the dress code: basically look like a hipster or a business person and you'll be fine. I wore a nice sweater (we went in February) and skinny jeans, and I didn't get any funny looks. My fiance wore a sweater and skinny jeans too (we are destined for each other, wearing the same clothing everywhere), and she was fine. These sweaters were not cosby sweaters though, they were more on the hipster side of the hipster/business casual.  Great service. Mediocre experience. Go elsewhere.

r_It6-0gHBNih0kqi9b6oA.text: While the food was fabulous, the wait staff was stiff, rude and even aloof.  I'd love to give the restaurant the 5 stars it deserves, but I can't get past how pretentious the staff is.

10BwE9J37rcjiexcdQgF1Q.text: It pains me a little to write this less-than-stellar review update, but after last night's bland birthday meal, I'm going to do just that.  I've always been a huge fan of Eleven and I'll certainly give it another try. But last night's entree was simply not good.  That's not to say the evening didn't have its highlights.  I'm in LOVE with Eleven's Mule.  Of course, show me any Moscow Mule and I'm bound to love it, but their's was especially tasty. I also very much enjoyed the beet and carrot salad, and our starter of Pumpkin Cavetelle was a solid "good."  However, my Seafood Tasting entree was fishy and bland. Comprised of salmon, scallop and crabcake, I [of course] expected to taste some fish. But you know when you get a serving a fish that's too fishy to enjoy? That was the case with the salmon and a bit with the scallop.  Neither had much flavor, so for the flavor to be all fishy, it just wasn't good. The crab cake wasn't far behind in the lack-of-flavor department.  Our server was extremely excited to be working there, so I'll give some kudos to him, but overall it was not a good entree experience.  I did try my guest's Pork Shank and it was amazing, so it must've just been an off night for the fish department.  Sad fish face... 8(

3UYFAKtrh_cRgoXjdNC2uQ.text: Eleven is a really good restaurant.  They always manage to please me.  They have two menus.  The fancy menu and the bar menu.  Are you feeling fancy, then order from the main Eleven menu?  Are you looking to keep costs down or just want a nice burger, order from the pub menu?  The restaurant is very nicely decorated.  The service is excellent.  They have an extensive wine and spirits selection.  Have friends coming in from the suburbs?  They have valet parking.  What makes them five star for me is the bread basket and the complementary caramel after your meal.  Their in house bread is amazing.  I usually forgo desert since I'm typically full, but the caramel is fun.

XUwXqmS-6njwn4q44A6apA.text: Let me say that I was on the lookout here... so many awesome reviews ... could it really be that great ??? Well I finally made my way here today for LUNCH. First & foremost the wait staff was attentive but not in your face, which I LOVE !!  I was skeptical of this place since it is a "chain" (Big Burrito) which, by most standards does not bode well to a high end venue.    I am corrected here. Big Burrito chain does not immediately scream high end value, atmosphere and culinary wonderment however, this place breaks the mold. It is upscale in atmosphere, their wait staff are knowledgeable and dressed appropriately.  The bar is FULL and affordable and the place is inviting. Ordered the Eleven burger and seared tuna with greens salad; all were wonderful. The tuna was seared with a salad of cous cous & greens & was delicious. The burger was to die for served with fresh cut fries & cooked just as I ordered !!!  I could have eaten two.   I loved the food and the service here.  I am looking to make plans to experience the chefs tasting menu.  I read/hear its wonderful. As far as today's lunch, it was delicious and service was spot on. I will be back and recommend this establishment; even though it is a Big Burrito chain restaurant.  Kaya (Big burrito too) is horrible but this one (i hope) is trying to break the chain reputation.   So far so good because everything we had today was delicious !! We will be back.  Can't wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Seared tuna.
Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Eleven burger.
Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

rbK5owKojHNXk92lS9DCZQ.text: I am so pleasantly pleased! We came here for my grandma's 80th birthday. We made reservations ahead of time and I don't know if it's because our party of 7 was big so there was no where else to accommodate us or they knew it was for a birthday, but we were seated in like a separate room which was nice! We can be loud, especially all 7 of us together, so it was nice we were partially separated. Throughout the meal, the wait staff was really friendly and patient with us. Deciding took a while and since my grandparents can't speak English, we had to do a lot of translating with them but they all just stood by patiently and were helpful with our questions.   The food was good! The steak tartare was good and so were the scallops. My grandparents both got the tasting menu and they got the white truffle tagliatelle as one of their courses. I got to try some and that was delicious. I loved it! For my entree, I got the ribeye. It was cooked well. The sides were good except the foie gras butter was a bit too strong for me.   For dessert, we splurged. The brown sugar ice cream cookie, banana creme pie, creme fraiche brulee, and the candy bar. They were glorious. I died at the banana creme pie. I pretty much ate the entire thing. The rest were all really good. I think the candy bar ended up being a bit too sweet for me, but not bad. It was like eating a really thick fudgy piece of chocolate. It was good but too big.  We had a lot of fun and had a great meal. Really good for special occasions.

qAiv3B3EvByqbV-SwjIlYg.text: I am giving three stars solely based on delicious food. The rest of the experience was a head scratcher. To say the staff is restrained is a major understatement. They seemed deeply unhappy. No smiles. Not friendly. When a large party is dining you expect a bit of a loss of privacy. But the constant barrage of water pouring was intrusive and obnoxious. We could never relax. Between us, we have dined at some amazing fine dining establishments in major cities around the world. Eleven needs to get over itself. There were diners in shorts and t-shirts. Lastly, did you charge us an automatic gratuity and then we tipped on top of it? It would have been nice if that was mentioned. If not, you need to perhaps revisit your pricing. All in all, delicious food served by an unfriendly staff in an uncomfortable environment.

DYxKfWcwfmS4LGHFhSke4w.text: We chose to do the prix fixe brunch: $29 for a cocktail, an appetizer, and an entree. Based on the regular prices of cocktails and entrees, the brunch at Eleven is a steal. I left 100% happy and gluttonously full.  A few negatives: Parking is either $5 for valet or $5 for the lot across the street. The price for two cocktails at the bar was a steep $24. We had to wait 15 minutes for a table I reserved a week prior that was on the second floor and had no visible reason to keep us waiting.  Back to the glowing food review...  I'm not sure I've ever had a brunch this tasty before. From the berry jam and whipped honey butter to hot, flaky pastries to grilled sticky to beignets with raspberry and Meyer lemon sauces to smoked pork huevos rancheros (lentils, goat cheese, tomatillo salsa = better than any preparation I had while living in Arizona for six years) - every bite I took was unique, delicious, and memorable. If I hadn't been stuffed to the gills, then I would have ordered everything again and eaten another round of brunch.   Other than Casbah, I'm not a huge fan of big Burrito Restaurant Group's restaurants. I think they are mostly over priced and underwhelming; however, Eleven delivers on pretty much every level: ambiance, quality and execution, service, and overall experience. I intend to save up some "fun" money to go back for dinner :)

VrhkB77Z2LgfAgnlRUnp1g.text: I have been a very big supporter of Eleven for many years, eating there often with family, friends, and business associates.  This past Tuesday, I met a business associate for drinks in the bar, hoping to have dinner afterwards.  I noticed a mouse near the bar, and thought it may have come in through the door.  I told the hostess what happened, she did not know hat to say.  when a returned to my seat, I noticed three additional mice running under the furniture.  When my business associate noticed one of the mice, she freaked out and we left the restaurant.  I wrote a letter to the Big Burrito group and told them what happened and got no response.  My favorite restaurant has a sanitation problem that needs to be addressed.  Too bad.

c2MyJQWseGCH3AngKaMvqQ.text: Eleven has a very nice happy hour from 4:00-6:00 with an assortment of interesting beverages and appetizers for $6.  Our large group tried the charcuterie platter, tuna tartare, pretzels, and oysters.  All were excellent (house made duck prosciutto a favorite) but the pretzels seemed to be deep-fried more like funnel cakes than a traditional pretzel.    The bar area is light and open and provided a nice view of the neighboring strip district.  The happy hour prices were reasonable but I cannot comment on the normal entrees or menu prices.  I'll be back to do so though!

photos.caption: Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. View from bar
Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. main dining area

bbzKm1jwRtGcPfsJmcHQlw.text: Decided to hit up Eleven for brunch again, and it definitely didn't disappoint again.  Outside of a minor service issue, which the manager quickly resolved, everything was spot on again.  While it's been around for some time, Eleven continues to be one of the staple Pittsburgh fine dining establishments (even better, it's not snobby fine dining either).

photos.caption: Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Breakfast breads
Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Grilled Stickies!
Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Beinets

kWIDXF-b0Nhyh4FlHqbCyg.text: Wow, I cannot say enough about this restaurant. The drinks are impeccable. The food is superb. My husband and I had brunch and though it's pricey, it's worth every penny. Definitely the best food in Pittsburgh, and it was perhaps the best meal I've had in my 30 years of life. We had the brunch menu, and there were good vegetarian options. The salad was outrageously flavorful and perfectly seasoned. The beignets were divine. I wish we could eat here every day! Everyone should eat at this restaurant!

g9LGgObMJlPkiGybE53ESQ.text: They have a nice happy hour selection of drinks. The mule was very delicious with fresh cucumbers and ginger. We ordered the happy hour pretzels as well. They were not so good, it might just be to fancy for me but they didn't taste good to us. They melted a slice on cheese on fried pretzels. From the description I was expecting something more delicious and I felt it was mediocre. Will be back for drinks and to try the food again.

photos.caption: Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

ICeBybrfDqQY2kZzgSL2hw.text: Food was good and location is really cool. On the river but also on the industrial edge of the 'Burgh.  I found the server to be arrogant and judgmental, though. I asked for some Keto customizations and other modifications and the reaction felt forced. Funny ... I'm the guy paying the bill. So, if you like Eleven as is, great. If you want individualized attention go somewhere else.

OoGNj2oNMfDmN0QugmWKoA.text: Visiting from out of state and decided to take a date out at this location. The lighting is set low and the ambiance is very radiant. This was definitely the effect I was going for.   Jonathan was very accommodating to our needs and made some terrific suggestions. The service was absolutely impeccable which made our experience that much more worth it. I look forward my next visit to the city with this place in mind.

photos.caption: Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

EoVmuU-4aOCDf7MJt9032w.text: First time in Pittsburgh. Stopped here for dinner since it was next to our hotel. Dinner was delicious. Ate off the tavern menu. Outdoor seating was just perfect. Service was good also. Definitely a must stop.

photos.caption: Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken Sandwich
Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Eleven burger

3ndvQZ5jP8E2j2bK-hP9Dw.text: Went there for a group dinner. The entrance was unassuming but the place was much larger than I expected.  wine cellar looked really nice and the positioning above the dining area was really creative.  The wine list was generally limited with a selection that was overpriced - except for a couple of gems...    Food was a set menu and consisted of several dishes.  I had a series of sushi style bites to start. The tuna tartare on toast was very fresh and had a nice ponzu dressing. The fried unagi in a blanket (I think it was as it was accompanied by the traditional bbq sauce) was a little too salty and the other sushi was very tasty.    The salad was very fresh and the greens excellent. dressing was light and was a great interlude before the salmon. The salmon was cooked perfectly and was really sushi quality.  Accompaniments were light and the whole taste and texture was well put together.  The only thing I would improve on is the balsamic - I expected some more than a drizzle on the side.  It would have been a perfect dish with a little more.    The negative item for me is that the service was generally slow. it took a while to get the wine, open it and serve it.  It also took a while for one person on our table to get their food - for every course.  The restaurant was not that busy so I am not sure what the issue was.    Will go back

photos.caption: Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

dtWyZvEncB-VA7-8xmO5NA.text: This was an amazing place to have an upscale dinner for a romantic evening with my wife. Food was amazing and my wife even was able to get a 5 course vegan dinner option with wine pairing! I would recommend this restaurant to anyone looking to have a great meal especially with a significant other.

oTUOMHg3C8QpNJxth7dy-Q.text: Awesome steak, really a great steak, good bread service, small but good selection of beers.  Not cheap look at spending at least $30 per person, but more like $40-50.  But you get what you pay for, excellent food.

photos.caption: Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

n_XrW4WHjG-7kP6cWVXQpQ.text: Definitely in my top five Pittsburgh restaurants. Everything about Eleven is carefully curated from the greeting you get when you walk in, to the service in the bar, to the friendly yet not intrusive service. The menu is varied, something for everyone, though occasionally I find myself wishing there were specials or that the seasonal preparations changed a bit more often. The food is impeccable, and when something goes awry they are always quick to fix it. I prefer to sit upstairs, the downstairs seating is a little "cold" to me, for lack of a better word. And the bar menu is also great. This is a place where you can wow your guests.

gtlQJ1WBnaKboNRRGoAxXw.text: If you're in the mood to spoil yourself at brunch o'clock, then come to Eleven.  Their brunch set includes an appetizer, a brunch item, and a drink for $29.  Between my fiance and I, we were able to sample their brunch menu very thoroughly.  Chicken and waffle:  the bite sized fried chicken and waffle was delicious.  I loved the spicy pickle.  Blueberry Beignet:  super sweet, not as fluffy as NOLA and wish it came out at the end as a dessert!  Pretty big sizing for one.  Get it to share.  Smoked lamb huevos rancheros:  MUST-GET.  The lamb to spice to egg pairing is phenomenal.  Linguine with lump crab:  A bit vanilla for brunch item.  The zucchini and vegetable was over cooked and created a lot of water, which watered down the uni citrus butter sauce.

GKkSXnNPgb1cyYkyrZIYpg.text: My colleague and I dropped by for a quick dinner and got in without reservation. Although we were told they were moving things around to accommodate us....hmmm- does being a pricey restaurant mean acting pricey too? :/ Anyhow, we were offered bread from the bread basket- there were 3 different breads- I tried the semolina and flax and raisin, they were both tasty ( I love bread). However, they were not warm, and as I slathered butter on my bread, there was a long strand of hair (no clue where it came from- butter or on the bread). The server was happy to give me new bread and change our butter and apologized. But hair= always worth a mention. Another disappointment- we weren't offered more bread as our bread cleared and we waited on our mains. Again- expectations from a high end restaurant= excellent service. I ordered the Ricotta Cavatelli- the pasta was cooked perfectly, and the chicken of the woods mushrooms were delicious. However, I would have loved the rest of the vegetables (beans, tomatoes) to have absorbed more of the sauce flavor. Overall, there could have been more basil, and more flavor. For a $24 pasta, it was on the bland side. The portion was generous, and lasted for another small lunch or breakfast (if you're into pasta for brekky!). We were also told the menu changes almost daily/weekly- however, in the last week that I've looked at the menu- it's been the same, so that was surprising. Maybe our server meant seasonally? :/ Another disappointment was the lack of vegetarian options. Potato gnochhi (as a small plate, not a main) and the ricotta cavatelli were the only solid vegetarian options, in addition to basic salads- which my coworker ordered, and thought was an average, decent salad, nothing to write home about.  I had been super excited to try Eleven- but alas I left unimpressed.

photos.caption: Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

MUxEYf7Dv-rvIG1Qiso-9Q.text: Great Atmosphere!  Very cool building.  The food was excellent.  Tuna Tartare, scallops, Beef tenderloin, banana cream pie all outstanding!  great drinks too :)

vQ31b1jvKwf4eFC-3IgSCg.text: We love the brunch at Eleven. It's very classy but not pretentious. The coffee is fantastic and the basket of breakfast breads (particularly the croissants) is amazing. It's easy to over-order as a result, but the prix fix deal is totally worth it. The brunch cocktails are all very good - today I had the Maple Bourbon Smash and it paired very well with the Waffle and bacon. My husband ordered the eggs Benedict (which he always gets) and this time his eggs were a little over cooked but all in all everything was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

w_B4tFY3BFOxtbK8iSYqQw.text: There seems to be a general apathy in the staff which in my opinion starts from the management level. We asked for a different table when we entered and the person at the door receiving us mentioned that "the floor above also has only a table and 2 chairs", she seemed displeased that we asked for a table away from the kitchen and infact gave us an impression that she was doing a favor by giving us a different table.  During the meal we asked for a vegetarian salad and they served lamb which we had a bite off before realizing that it isn't what we ordered, the manager came and asked us if we were allright and we decided not to make a big deal and said ok - he just said ok and with no apology walked away. We truly experienced how lack of customer focus flows from the management to the folks on the floor! Would recommend Spoon or twisted French men instead of this place if you are looking for a romantic night.

zdTFXfmKMQAu7cG0fb4uaA.text: We came here with six people.  We had a reservation, but came early for a drink at the bar.  The bar area is great with a long bar but also plenty of couches.  The bartender was great and made a very nice Moscow Mule.  There are a few beers on tap.  The hostess waited till we were finishing our drinks and then came to get us for seating.  Our server arrived with drink list.  Wine was the drink of choice.  I am not a wine person, but there did seem to be a wide selection.  The wine came without delay.  The oysters were fresh and not too heavy on the brine.  The lobster bisque was good, but pretty short on the lobster meat!    The sea scallops appetizer was great.  Be warned that it only comes with two scallops but they were fresh and had a great flavor.  We also had the beet salad.  This was pretty standard.   Good enough though.  The scottish salmon was done medium rare as I like it.  The portions size was bigger than expected - a pleasant surprise.  The brussel and parsnip were great addition.  Desert was the creme brulee.  Good stuff.  Eleven- I am a fan!

photos.caption: Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Scenes from the bar

c2J4kr1mwB8KHC182VVKEw.text: The food was delicious! Would be a great date night restaurant. We mistakenly thought this restaurant was more causal and brought our 3 girls (3 yo, 6 yo, and 8 yo) with us + they were accommodating. Highly recommend the restaurant.

FSB2u9bfkfs-bKDk2LwoaQ.text: Popped in for lunch because I signed up for the 'birthday club' and received a coupon for a free entree at any of their restaurants.  Great deal for just going to lunch at Mad Mex a few dozen times a year... Got there at 2:00 which is in between their lunch & dinner shifts so I sat at the bar.  Brian greeted me right away bringing over a glass of water and a basket of bread and menus.  I decided on the Lobster Roll that came w sides (I chose the seas at salad) and I ordered a Sly Fox Pike Pilsner.  The beer was fresh & light and had a great taste.  I was only into half a piece of bread when my lunch arrived.   The Caesar salad was DELICIOUS.  It has a fantastic taste and the calamata olives gave it a nice tang.  The kosher pickle spear was a perfect addition.  The lobster roll itself was very good.  The grilled roll was very fresh and the lobster salad inside was good.  This was my first ever lobster roll but not my first lobster.  The filling was mostly claw meat but it wasn't all completely cooked.  There was a distinct springiness to the meat that I don't think is there if cooked completely.  I could be wrong...   Overall, my visit was exceptional. Service was excellent, the place was spotless...  I would definitely come back for lunch or dinner.  Maybe even the next time I'm looking for a special place to bring the wife for dinner...   Thank you...!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lobster roll w Caesar salad...

-kJzV7UzJ-8dfR__iHNZDQ.text: Fantastic location for a prix fixe Brunch - pick a cocktail or juice, an appetizer, and an entree for $29. I started off with the Newton's apple cocktail which reminded me a mojito with an apple kick. Super delicious, I may have to learn how to make this on my own. For the appetizer, I picked the grilled sticky which is a grilled cinnamon bun in the shape of french toast, with an amazing bacon butterscotch reduction drizzled on top. This hefty appetizer was absolutely out of this world and it was hard to stop myself from devouring the whole thing, especially since my goat cheese and mushroom omelette was coming up next. The omelette came with a side of crispy fingerling potatoes mixed with fried shallots and a bit of spicy seasoning and bacon. These were probably some of the best breakfast potatoes I've ever had, and the black pepper bacon was really something else. The omelette was packed with goat cheese (always a plus in my books) and cooked to perfection.   Overall an incredibly delicious place for brunch with a lot of variety and options. Brunch is absolutely well worth the price for everything you get. Service was excellent and I definitely plan to make this place one of my regular upscale go-to brunch locations.

photos.caption: Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Newton&#39;s Apple
Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Goat cheese omelette with a side of black pepper bacon and CRISPY fingerling potatoes
Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Grilled Sticky with bacon butterscotch syrup. This alone could be a meal itself.

SeYLeQTy_Q4XMu9qDPISeg.text: A friend and I decided to go to celebrate my birthday. We chose Eleven because we both had Big Burrito restaurant group coupons, and Eleven's menu sounded enticing. Lately I'm in the habit of going in to try restaurants during the dead period around 2-3 PM for late lunch... The benefit is that places are usually slow and there's no issue finding a table. The downside is, many places are short-staffed during this time, and this is the exact issue we had on our visit. There was just one waiter for the 'tavern' side. Although he was very gracious and polite, he had to juggle 3 tables, the bar, and a gin vendor all at once. It took a while to order dessert because he was talking gin!  But now, to the meal: Cocktails were a must. I ordered a "Newton's Apple". It was alright. The apple pieces within were a bit brown and soft... not disgustingly so, just enough to be disappointing. My friend's "Starry Night" was much better; I'd absolutely recommend that drink. I ordered the Lobster Roll with a side salad. The salad took up a full half of the plate and was beautiful and colorful, loaded with arugula... My favorite! The lobster roll was stuffed full of a generous portion of lobster. Although it wasn't anything revolutionary, there are some things that are just so exquisite in their usual form. Lobster rolls are one of those things. My friend got the Eleven Burger (a veal sandwich). It too was jam-packed with so much meat. He got a Cesar side salad; again, quite a generous portion. We ordered a dessert to split: the Creme Fraiche Brulee. (I triple-checked their menu to make sure I got all those little accents right, FYI). It came with a Raspberry Almond Macaron, which was preety good, and fresh raspberries, which were Wonderful. Nothing about a restaurant impresses me more than very fresh, perfectly ripe raspberries... Nothing is better. The Creme Brulee itself was fluffy goodness under a crisp, warm blanket of wonderful caramelized sugar. After dessert, the waiter surprised us with a special treat: Truffles filled with a Banana Cinnamon mixture and a chocolate sign that read "Happy Birthday"! I loved the combination, and the waiter even ran back and grabbed me two more! My pal wasn't as fond of the truffles, but Banana Cinnamon is a bold combination that isn't really for everyone.  In conclusion, even though at times it was a little wait before we could get something ordered, the experience here was very pleasant and it felt like the staff here put a lot of effort into making things special.

photos.caption: Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The bakery gave me a special birthday treat!
Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Creme Fraiche Brulee
Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lobster roll

U4ig99OA8nxFhVrUNrvHlA.text: After attending the Best Restaurants party in June I made a beeline for Eleven since it was my favorite taste from the party. First of all the space was huge and gorgeous- they can accommodate large parties and also have a beautiful terrace we were able to enjoy our meal on. My husband and I shared a gnocchi appetizer and tuna tartare, both were very tasty but the entrees were what really shined. I had the swordfish which was cooked perfectly and paired with a rich shrimp risotto. He had the strip steak that had a french onion sauce, cheese curd mashed potatoes, and onion rings. Both were large portions and bursting with flavor (I even took a third of my dish home). When we got the dessert menu we couldn't turn down the candy bar dessert- a must for any chocolate peanut butter fan. When we left my husband stated he has a new favorite restaurant in Pittsburgh.

ErJyFcN4sb7vwZ1JRhrzHA.text: We had an excellent Mother's Day Brunch in this stylish and sophisticated restaurant. They offered a fixed price, 3 course (one is an alcoholic beverage of your choice) menu that we all thoroughly enjoyed. My standout main dish was a Lamb Huevos Ranceros.

vTcVuqYHUgt91SY4IViSfA.text: My waiter, Josh, helped me decide right off the bat that I wanted to sample a little of everything and take advantage of your small plates. He knew the menu extensively and took the time to explain everything to me. The edemame was different than any I've ever had (old bay, lemon juice, BACON!) and the flavors surprisingly complimented each other very well. The tuna tartare also had an amazing flavor combination. Overall the plates were filling. They were all served within 5-10 minutes of me ordering. The service is outstanding. The best part? It was a truly enjoyable experience. I will definitely be returning with employees and customers alike. Thank you!

oc0dQMJCMms3zIh2aASttg.text: Excellent high quality eats in downtown Pittsburgh. Great location, with excellent design. Service at the bar is great. Locally sourced produce and meats make this a must when visiting downtown.  I had the seafood sambler...and requested a side of th roasted sweet potatoes.  Heavenly. Great wine a selection as well.

nHGw2bktzZSmn14J_J68PA.text: Needed to find a suitable space for a wedding rehearsal dinner and Eleven fit the bill.  Let me say that everything about the event was perfect!  Perfect!  The reservation process, the food, the drinks, and especially the staff was all top notch.  What a way to kick off our celebration in Pittsburgh.  Thank you, Eleven, and especially Jen Johnson.  We will be back.  Oh, the chef even adjusted the menu to cater to our non-dairy preference, including the excellent deserts.  Over the top!

vUJISBtuhbiyWUKdNKRZMg.text: The restaurant is nice. We stopped by on a Sunday evening and it wasn't very busy which was great as it made the ambiance more intimate. As I am not familiar with the surrounding area, I will say that it's a nice restaurant in a kind of abandoned area.   Sea scallops: Excellent. Sea scallops atop some creamy cheesy grits. If I were uncouth, I would have licked the plate clean.

AK_uXHm0kDuzmHKln-FSGg.text: My boyfriend and I, with our parents, visited Eleven for a celebration dinner. The service, food, and atmosphere were truly as good as it gets. My mom of course wanted to switch tables to outside on the patio, which the staff accommodated quickly and effortlessly. The patio was lovely and they even had heaters on. Our waitress was in training, however she was phenomenal and told jokes and became a fun part of the evening. We ordered tuna tartare, plum soup, and crab cakes which were all delicious appetizers. I split the halibut and swordfish which were very tasty. Everyone had clear plates at the end of the meal. I brought a Prantl's cake, which they brought out to show the table and then had sliced in the kitchen. Overall, it was such a delightful and fun evening, which all the staff at Eleven made possible. My parents are quite picky diners and they absolutely loved the restaurant.

6gt60ik8A5hkO7XPfv5O6w.text: This place was AMAZING! My family and I don't usually go to places as fancy as this, but we went out to a really nice dinner to celebrate graduation. We went all out - drinks, soups, entrees, and dessert. Everything was perfect.  The food was delicious - I had a seafood sampler and it was some of the best seafood I've had on the east coast. Everything was prepared perfectly and all the flavors on the plate complimented each other perfectly. The soup I had as an appetizer was one of the most delicious things I have ever tasted. The desserts we had were also incredible (We had the molten chocolate cake, hazelnut candy bar, and creme brulee). I had the leven-ade to drink, and it was wonderful.  Also, when the wait staff found out my family and I were there to celebrate graduation, they put a chocolate plaque that said "Congratulations" on it! The wait staff was also super friendly, personable and attentive. All in all, this was one of the best dining experiences I've had in my life.

3PxIQgI5pW1gjAbcldyJjw.text: Fantastic meal at happy hour! At at the bar on Oct. 20, 2015. Everything on the Happy Hour menu is $6, including drinks. I had classic martinis and you get to choose the gin you would like...including top of the line Hendrick's, all for the same $6 price. My friend drank Americanos: gin, Campari and blood orange juice, which were top notch. We ordered all the items on the food menu except for the tuna and mussels. (Wish we had them, though.) Actually we had four orders of the oysters and eagerly devoured a dozen of those perfectly delicious bivalves each. The shishito peppers were new to us and a wonderful discovery. Easy to eat, not hot. Just great...will have to find them locally now. Also high marks for the calamari and onion rings. Although the soft pretzels were our least favorite, they were delicious. Warm, cheesy, bread-like. To us, nothing could beat the oysters and peppers, but I am sure there are people who would rank the pretzels their favorite. The bartender was friendly and helpful.  Too bad this is four hours away or we would be there every week!

3-cwAoFwjeygFu6EWuWW6Q.text: Eleven does a nice job being inventive but not over the top when it comes to pairing flavors. They cure their own meat, dishes are gluten free and they have a wine storage area upstairs.  Chef Derek Reynolds put a nice menu together here.   We tried the kale salad and beet salad. I must admit the beet salad w cured meat and manchego cheese was the best I ever tried. We then ordered all appetizers - 5 of them.   Scale of 1-5 w 5 being spectacular:  Steak tartare:  3  Tuna tartare:  3 Scallops:  5 (scallops are usually meh, boring... not these. Huge sushi grade diver scallops prepared the most unique way ever seen. This is a home run dish!) "Spaghetti":  4 (w lobster and uni) Crab cakes:  4 (all lump, very tasty, potatoes on the side seemed out of place)  Wine:  personally, I would stick "by the glass".  Wine list is pretty heavily dominated by Cali wines that are over priced.  We did find a really nice Amarone 2009 that retails for $70 at big box retailers w a small margin on top. Other than that the Mumm Rose Champagne is a good value and nice for a starter or end game after dinner at $12/glass or $60/bottle.    The entrees appear dull at first but take the time to read how the dishes come together and you'll be intrigued. I think the tasting menu is kind of half assed - a vegetarian option for $45 and a meat one for $65 w optional wine pairing at $25. They should ramp this up, give options, allow for add on's (foie gras etc) and ditch the wine pairings until the list catches up to food quality.   The service is friendly and prompt but I don't get the impression that everyone is immersed in the passion/knowledge of food.   We will come back again.

Z14qPr7hw-fiLLlI9FPyTw.text: We went for Sunday brunch. I knew it would be good, but it exceeded my expectations. The smoked lamb huevos rancheros was delicious, and the omelet my wife ordered had the fluffiest eggs I've ever tasted. Dessert and drinks were equally as awesome.  We'll definitely do brunch here again soon.

Z9AgzwleNTqDTiIOlZpdZA.text: The happy hour is one of the best in the city.  $6 drinks and apps from 4-6 everyday.  I had the Pinot and my friend had the Syrah.  Amazing wines, the Pinot is reguarly a $20 glass and the Syrah is $15.    Service is great.    This is a review only on the drinks, we did not eat.

DGdeQx7qyIBoWcKg98a7cQ.text: Wonderful! We were there with a group of six to celebrate an anniversary. All the food was outstanding and well-cooked. My group had the seafood tasting, tenderloin, and salmon. Everyone had very positive things to say about their meals. Delicious! We also tried the candy bar and banana cream pie for dessert -- both were amazing! I always appreciate a restaurant that has a good chocolate dessert, and the candy bar was right up my alley! The chef even prepared a small white chocolate "happy anniversary" sign for our group. Staff was courteous and our food came out quickly. Wonderful wonderful wonderful!

-EZUpzoJbcxrqGl74zZfkA.text: Nice interior. Great salad and appetizers well prepared halibut. Ok dessert. 50/50 shot on service. Either fantastic or abysmal from my two visits. Could use a little more consistency there.

mPb-5vrVtLrHLLNgpdKPeA.text: This place is so over the top amazing. The open kitchen, the gorgeous bar and the completely separate, glass enclosed pastry/bread kitchen off to the side are all impressive. Today, we had the Sunday brunch. I loved the salmon entree, cooked perfectly with fennel and pea shoots and paired with a Bloody Mary. Delicious.Their food is so much better than so many other restaurants. I love the company Big Burrito. This is their flag ship, high end restaurant and I've never been disappointed here.

FTVhOWZrVk7c4yIYc0EfDA.text: The service and food at Eleven have been impeccable on every occasion that I have visited.  Servers and chefs are detail-oriented beyond reproach and they anticipate your needs before you have them.  My favorite entrees here tend to be fish (especially halibut, when they have it).  Flavors are fresh and the menu changes often enough to keep things interesting.  Food presentation is phenomenal too, especially with desserts.  We have come for a few milestones (birthdays, anniversaries, etc.) and they always acknowledge them with a special treat.

4s1cT91FkGsuHtcZMab9NQ.text: We had a fabulous dinner here last weekend. There were 4 of us and we each had something different. I was the only vegetarian in the group. I can't say enough about the creative dishes, the presentation and the service. It is not inexpensive but definitely worth the price. Locally sourced produce. My husband said the snapper was delicious. I understand the menu changes daily based upon what is available. The ambience is very nice. Very modern but with an old world feel.

6hMEYFv1Q7CGOdwOV0giwQ.text: The first thing I noticed when my guests and I walked in was the design of this place. It is really nice. After trying several "just okay" restaurants in Pitttsburgh, I was ready for a great meal. My party and I had read many reviews of Pitt restaurants, and this sounded like our best shot at a great "fine dining" experience in this city.  We were extremely disappointed. Sorry, but I'm convinced there is no fine dining in Pittsburgh.   We all had the Price Fixe Tasting menu ( quite pricey for what it was, btw ), and none of us liked it. The lamb was too spicy, and the wine pours were really small.Three and a half hours for four courses?  Wow, the pacing of the entire meal was just dismal. I don't think it was the server's fault, though- she seemed to be trying most of the time. Maybe it was the kitchen's fault? I'm not sure, but this was just ridiculous. I shouldn't have my wine pairing glass 45 minutes before it's accompanying dish. Yet we did. A couple of times.   Also, I am gluten free, but usually this doesn't matter at nice restaurants. Eating  out and staying GFree is becoming easier I am finding. So many restaurants have GF offerings and substitutions available.  Eleven, however, was not gluten free friendly at all. Nor did the server even seem aware of what GFree is. After awhile, the Bread cart coming around EVERY FIVE MINUTES got to be humorous. Even to the rest of my party, who CAN eat bread. Seriously, if the rest of the place was as on the ball as the bread guy, maybe our experience would've been slightly better here.

hwmOy6MnCSIzqFWLmxZ3Nw.text: Consistently great.  Been here many times, and is our go-to for special occasions.  The Negative Nancy in me always thinks somehow there'll be a misstep, but it never happens.   Our table had:  oysters, cavatelli, sashimi, beef tenderloin, seafood sampler, chefs tasting, and salad.  Even the salad was memorable.  Service terrific.  New chef well on his way.

f7KZMwXt6Nw8HQSHEgb_gg.text: I had their Brunch  using the  birthday coupon. The food was good  but  the service was really bad. The waiter was rude the  whole time and  so slow. When we complain  to the manger  , Jenifer  didn't do  anything, nor cared. We ate there before and the alcohol drinks were too strong same thing this time.

kZiDtAGL3piwYM99B069uQ.text: Went here for an anniversary dinner per my husband's recommendation. Had no idea what I was getting myself into. We ordered blind off chef's select menu and while the items sounded eclectic, I was amazed by how delicious the courses tasted! The service was acceptable, nothing exceptional, but I didn't even care. The food rocked and I hope we return again every anniversary. Delish!

ssF-5uUkEJR1BQ6LXyvWiA.text: Food and service amazing, we came for Sunday brunch and it was excellent food and excellent service, I would highly recommend this place too anyone looking for great food in the strip area. Very upscale and very tasty food!

ufEwiSjUSnk6wTb4amvRvQ.text: Went to the strip district for my 33 birthday dinner this past weekend with my wife. We had great service and even better food probably the best burger and steak we have ever eaten. Local farm to table foods. We ate at the bar  I will most certainly come back but id make a reservations

Ae5EjAY9B3y0Afwn9dhXWw.text: I had been wanting to eat here for years. When I received my Big Burrito Birthday Coupon this year- I knew right away that we were going to come here. We made a reservation on a Friday night for about 6:00 pm. There really weren't that many people here, so a reservation wasn't completely necessary. The service was excellent from the start to the finish. I started off with a Moscow mule, which was delicious. I then had the cold strawberry soup, which was unique and really good. I loved the basil granola that was on top. It was really different and I'm glad I tried it. While we were waiting for our meals, a gentleman came by with three bread options. I had the sea salt and the raisin and both were really good. For dinner, I had the chicken dish which was served with risotto and swiss chard. It was WONDERFUL. I ate the entire thing. It was so incredibly flavorful. The risotto was perfect and so tender and the chicken was so juicy with crispy skin. So good. Brendan had the hanger steak, which he really enjoyed. His came with roasted cauliflower which he normally doesn't like, but he loved it. It also came with a potato and horseradish cake, which complimented the steak so well. For dessert, I went with the three different types of gelato- cherry, guava, and mandarin orange. To my surprise, the three little scoops were presented with an assortment of fresh berries and small baked goods. It even had a piece of white chocolate with "Happy Birthday" on it for me. The guava gelato was my favorite- Brendan enjoyed a fresh chocolate chip cookie. As if we didn't eat enough, the waiter gave us little lemon truffles when he gave us the check. So good. We were so impressed and I am really looking forward to returning. I am dying to check out their Happy Hour sometime- their bar has a different menu, and I am curious to try their burgers and more casual menu items.

photos.caption: Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Selection of Sorbets- guava, mandarin orange, cherry; and a birthday wish on top!
Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Moscow Mule &amp; Fresh Bread
Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chilled Strawberry Soup   |   $10 basil yogurt, almond-brioche crumble, olive oil

-WALDINVynbQFUwk5DN65g.text: The moment you walk through the door of Eleven, you just know this is a place where you'll be well tended. The space has the feel of an opulent loft. The bar is beautiful and the dining spaces are intimate and comfortable, even in an open area.   The food and service we've experienced here have always been exceptional! We've done special occasion dinners here before and today discovered what an amazing lunch spot Eleven can be. Definitely more on the fine dining scale than our typical lunchtime fare and what a nice treat it turned out to be!   My husband ordered hangar steak with fries and I ordered the sea scallops with roasted cauliflower over delightfully peppery polenta, radicchio and crunchy focaccia croutons. Both our dishes were spot on! Interesting, flavorful and well balanced. Honestly, perfect!   Service by Glenn was attentive and personable. We both looked at each other during our meal and said, why don't we come here more often? Well it's on our radar now!

photos.caption: Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sea Scallops with roasted cauliflower, Parmesan, polenta &amp; radicchio. Perfection!!!!

3w7gIEfmU5bPRFfV9o-v6g.text: I was not expecting to find a place like this open so late in Pittsburgh! We came in at the last seating and called ahead, and the person on the phone (I think his name was Elliot) was so polite and well spoken. He was the deciding factor that made us rush in to grab a table.  We sat outside on their beautiful and romantic upstairs deck. Service was impeccable, from start to finish it was friendly, attentive, and elegant. Our waiter answered all of our questions about the menu.  I ordered the Scottish Salmon, served in a cream sauce with (I think) wood ear mushrooms. These were the earthiest mushrooms I've ever had, a very deep and intriguing flavor. The salmon was cooked perfectly. The boy ordered a seafood sampler type of entree, my favorite item being the scallops.
