For dessert we split the banana cream pie, which is structured more like a napoleon with drizzlings of caramel and meringue chips. I'm not a sweets person but this was very good. And they have a killer bread basket too.

Qtboi5LH2-k399ImIYRMhw.text: This was such a delicious dinner and well worth the price. Our waiter told us the menu constantly changes according to freshest ingredients. We started with the scallops, which were so good, but you only get 2 just an FYI. For entree's I had the beef tenderloin and my boyfriend had the swordfish. Both were extremely flavorful and great portion sizes! They had a very large dessert menu as well, so we chose 2. The creme brulee was perfect and came with a macaroon! My boyfriend had the candy bar which was very good too. We both loved the atmosphere and interior decor and the service was excellent. We'll definitely be back!

n0yFX1Sx2N3lFssUsXuMeg.text: Eleven has some of the best service I experienced in Pittsburgh. The staff was accommodating, knowledgable, and delightfully friendly. In terms of ambiance, Eleven has one of the most elegant restaurants I've dined at.   I stopped in for brunch with my girlfriend and we shared the Steak & Eggs along with the Cresta di Gallo. The steak was cooked perfectly. The dish was very filling. The Cresta was an elbow like pasta which was served with a delicious sauce and topped with mushrooms, pesto, goat cheese, and pine nuts. It was prepared a little too salty for my liking. Similarly to the steak and eggs, it was very filling.  Prior to receiving our main courses, we had a complimentary bread basket and a grilled stickey. The bread basket was outstanding. I've never had w better complimentary item. It came with biscuits, a blueberry muffin, a brown sugar muffin, and a croissant. All four were great!

L6_nWnQn_g-oLCa5vDrwBw.text: Stopped by Eleven for happy hour so I can't speak to dinner there. Happy hour is 4-6 Monday through Friday and they have a rotating menu of small bites and mixed drinks for $7. There are some beer and wine specials too.  The only food we tried were the confit chicken wings, but they were delicious. Otherwise we just had a couple drinks at the bar where our bartender was friendly and helpful.

photos.caption: Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Happy hour menu

jAmxmPmZJL6043a0mSGxpA.text: Excellent experience here on a business dinner recently. The service was flawless, the food was on-point, and the restaurant is comfortable and highly enjoyable. I had the foie gras and then the chicken. They hit the right notes with both dishes, which were served promptly at the proper temperature for enjoyment - not allowed to cool down and lose their flavor by sitting on a rack somewhere. Great wine list, and a nice bar to sit at before your meal to have a drink with friends. They know exactly how to mix casual comfort with refined flavors! Will definitely be back soon!

GStfkuhJTG8v3Iy_o9wPdg.text: We came here for lunch a little after they opened on a weekday and loved every edible item that landed our table (minus the complimentary oatmeal cookies at the end but it was a kind gesture).  We didn't order much but their food was incredibly filling!    Their focaccia bread alone kicked up my appetite.  We shared their butternut squash soup ($10).  It was light yet creamy on the tongue.   For entrees, we had the Seared Rare Tuna Salad ($18) and the Strozzapreti ($18).  MOST delicious tuna ever - it was pink in the middle of each thick slice and crispy on outside.  The strozzapreti was the BEST pasta dish I ever had.  The tomato-bean-oregano sauce was delicious.  All the ingredients in the dish were fresh and of HIGH quality - soft burrata cheese, creamy non-bitter rapini (I thought it was spinach!) sweet thick-skinned Castelvetrano olives (looked like small green pepper buds to me), and sharp, acidic tomatoes to contrast everything else in the plate.  The presentation of the dishes additionally matched the upscale ambience of Eleven.    We had drinks (yes at noon!) and dessert as well.  The Spice Cake ($10) was moist and amazing.  I loved their Ruby Red vodka ($10) cocktail.  Sweet and refreshing.    One of the best meals in my life!  Food, service, ambience, and price all 5/5!

photos.caption: Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Dessert menu
Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Spice cake
Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

EOWPDYPcLzLBmXNke6ONNw.text: My husband and I just moved to Pittsburgh and wanted to celebrate my birthday with my family, who were coming in from out of town. After researching a few places, we settled on Eleven.  When we first arrived we appreciated the fact that Eleven offers valet parking for $6 since we were worried the lots in that area wouldn't stay open late enough on a Tuesday night.  We were seated upstairs. Our waiter, Miles, was incredibly attentive and caught on quickly that it was my birthday (and made sure to let the dessert chef know to add an adorable happy birthday sign to my dessert). He was helpful in helping some of our party order their entree and he helped us all pick a great wine. When dishes arrived, he made sure to explain any of the sauces or special features of the dish (like how all bread is made in-house).  I ordered the beef tenderloin which was perfect. It was served on top of a bed of a few gnocchi which were also delicious. Everyone at my table thoroughly enjoyed their meals.  Eleven would make for a great dinner for a romantic date night, celebrating a special occasion, or a nice meal with a client as it is a nice, quiet atmosphere. We didn't spend any time in the bar area, but it looked very nice with a few TVs. Our drinks were fantastic so I imagine the bar would also make for a nice time.

1CdNUU7ZiIJau3lwos4c8g.text: Great food and very nice atmosphere. This place is particularly good for business dinners--close to downtown, easy parking, and large tables separated from each other. I am saying this because most of the new trendy restaurants around town have small tables and are too close to each other, so this is one of my favorite places for business occasions. Outstanding tartare and swordfish

OmiK36MAPVn7VZ0lFFdWPA.text: As a Big Burrito restaurant fan, I excitedly receive my birthday coupon every March and carefully decide which restaurant to return to or try for my birthday. This year, I chose to try Eleven with my husband.  I did not put much effort into my outfit for my birthday and immediately regretted this decision when I walked into this beautiful restaurant. It's modern and trendy while still feeling classy and elegant. I wished there was a J Crew or Banana Republic next door so I could quickly buy a new outfit and redo my entrance.  Even though I would have enjoyed experiencing the buzz of dining here on the weekend, we came here on a very quiet Monday night. When we first arrived, we literally had a large section of the 2nd floor all to ourselves. Our service for the entire evening was excellent! Our waitress was absolutely fabulous, and I believe her name was Liz.   With an impressive restaurant space and excellent service, I hoped that dinner would absolutely knock my socks off. It was very good, but didn't absolutely blow me away. Though everything was solid and well executed, I did not have anything so delicious that I've been dreaming about returning to have those items again.  We started with the Jumbo Lump Crab Crack, which was very tasty and had a nice balance of crab meat. My husband decided to go big and ordered the Prime Beef Ribeye. The cut of meat was enormous, but I thought that for $52 the flavors and tenderness could be better. As I had a free birthday entree coupon, I decided to have the Chef's Tasting Menu. The menu changes from time to time, but I had Tuna Tartare and Jubilee Hilltop Ranch Strip Steak. Sadly, I can't remember the 2nd course (even though I took a picture of it!). For dessert, my waitress said that I could order something not on the Tasting Menu, so I went for the Banana Cream Pie. Once again, everything was good, but for the price, none of my food was so incredible that I want to go back asap. My favorite item the entire meal might have been the Banana Cream Pie, which was beautiful, unique, and delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Amazing Banana Cream Pie @ Eleven

rRV2FrtTvJdAulIKeEfisw.text: Great bartender, (long hair Chinese guy you're great) our server was ok. Seemed like he didn't care we were there ... almost as it was a privilege for us to be there.. We started with a few cheeses then got the hanager steak and chicken. All very good. The risotto on the chicken was amazing. All other staff was friendly over all. We do plan to return to the bar area though. I just wish our server was a little more personable, and friendly. I get it's Pittsburgh and we're all a little harsh but just read your tables servers!! You'll have a few nice easy tables if you let it!! We really did enjoy ourselves overall and have good things to say about Eleven. All I want is nice personable service :)

i4v73FbTu0QA-fU787aTQg.text: Took my mom here for a birthday brunch today and we had a lovely experience. Our waiter was excellent - friendly and attentive without being overbearing. Let us take our time poring over the menu, but also made sure to let us know what items they were running low on. We did the brunch prix fixe ($29 for appetizer, entree and cocktail) and were happy with all of our choices. For my brunch cocktail I chose the Maple Smash which was delightful and I will be trying to copy the recipe at home. Mom had a sweet potato puree soup to start, very yummy. I was decidedly less healthy and ordered the last order of (thank you, Joe, our waiter!) beignets...out of this world. My entree, the steak and egg was delicious, but not quite hot, which I find to be a common problem with brunch. We were way too full for dessert. We left very full and happy...birthday brunch for mom a success!

photos.caption: Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

H7ZpE0SneVeRVS6M7pjcQg.text: I have never had a bad meal here.  I love the foi gras three ways!

rH--d6t-dm3FOqdQmI2okQ.text: Not your average Sunday Brunch but in a good way!  Go with the price fixe menu and enjoy an appetizer and a main course while sipping on a cocktail.  Well worth it. Can't wait to try it again.

IgBWfAStkHLN9iQuRtbjZQ.text: Eleven is currently my favorite restaurant in Pittsburgh. The menu is fantastic because it is gourmet and interesting without being 'over the top' foodie with things like eye balls and tongues. I'll stick with a regular cut of meat that is dressed up a bit, thank you! Service is top-notch every time from the valets to the person refilling the water. I love all of the little extras offered at the restaurant like a coat check and the complimentary after-dinner treats. Tip: If you don't have cash, you can pay for your valet and tip the valet on your credit card with your dinner check.   The wine list at Eleven is wonderful and I have yet to be disappointed by any of their reds by the glass or by the bottle. They offer a selection that caters to any wine budget, with bottles ranging from about $40 to more expensive choices that climb up to several hundred dollars. In addition to wine, I've had several cocktails and my boyfriend has had scotch, and both have been great.   The food is always timed right and is cooked to perfection, with sides that are just as good as the main course. My only complaint is that there is a lot of gratuitous oil and butter on pretty much everything. I am sure they would cook things healthier if I asked, but I don't like it when everything comes out glistening. I find that the portions tend to be generous, with the exception of scallops. 2 scallops for $18? That's a bit of a racket.   The menu is seasonal, so there is always something new to try when I go, which is great. That being said, I hope the spice cake is never taken off the menu as it is one of the best desserts I have ever had anywhere (I've been lucky enough to get it two visits in a row!).   Four stars instead of five because the ladies room is frequently trashed and there are a few tables upstairs that are bad (a long line of 2 tops where you feel like you have to keep your arms pinned to your side to avoid bumping the stranger next to you on the booth).   All in all, Eleven is superb. It is a bit pricey, but not crazy expensive and never disappoints. I hope that things stay great when Chef Derek moves on to new opportunities in a few weeks.

photos.caption: Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Steak tartare and scallops appetizers
Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Delicious Syrah
Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Swordfish

Zu-orn6G3JVpn2Vt20qh5A.text: I went to eleven for my birthday dinner with my parents. We had plans to explore Pittsburgh and my mom had read about this restaurant. We were running late and called to ask if they would be able to accommodate us and they said they could. We arrived 15 minutes late and they sat us right away. Our waiter was very attentive and had recommendations for us for both drinks and dinner. We had crab cakes and eggplant for appetizer. Both were absolutely delicious. We had chicken and halibut for our entrees. The chicken was deliciously tender.  The halibut was very flaky. For desert we had chocolate cake which was decorated with a happy birthday chocolate. We also had banana creme pie which was delicious. Overall, we had an excellent meal. It was pricey would be my only negative. Also, it is in a slightly low traffic area which as a tourist always makes me feel slightly uneasy.

photos.caption: Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

OE2EbSh_UaMSb0UJRzgfYA.text: I can't imagine any of the Big Burrito restaurants getting anything less than five stars and Eleven is no exception.  I came here for brunch with my friend who was visiting from hotlanta and gave her yet another reason to return to Pittsburgh - the opportunity to dine at Eleven again. We both opted for the prefix because 1) it's an amazing deal for $29 and 2) it gives you the opportunity to sample different bites.   I had an AMAZING bloody Mary, followed by some tasty hash and then finished with an omelet.  I had to box half my meal and was so glad to enjoy this breakfast over two days. The little basket of tasty pastries served with brunch is also worth noting.   Service is great as well.  And you can make reservations ahead of time, which you should do, because this place is always busy.

yjVJdexnDd3QcGUGZGWsFw.text: While not quite in the stratospheric realm of, say, an Aureole in NY or a Citronelle in Washington, Pittsburgh's Eleven is an outstanding dining experience.  The food is creative, beautifully presented, and thoroughly enjoyable.  The service is attentive and professional, but not at all stuffy.  The wine list is extensive and they are able to recommend some amazing food-wine pairings.  All in all, thoroughly first rate.  I opted for the regular tasting menu.  The first sign of good things to come was the homemade bread.  It was yeasty and chewy and it took effort not to keep asking for more.  The first course was a small place of tuna sashimi on a "lemon miso."  The citrus flavor of that sauce was perfect with the meltingly soft fish -- I mean, this was like cream cheese and lox from a parallel and far more elegant universe.          Then there was a porcini mushroom risotto garnished with a piece of taleggio cheese that melted into the rice.  It was exquisitely rich and gooey, and the pinot grigio I had with it balanced the dish perfectly.  What a treat.       This was followed, a plate of salmon, with morel mushrooms, lentils and fava beans.  The salmon was cooked impeccably -- moist but not raw or cold --  and the accompaniments made a great contrast.         Then there was lamb on polenta with some braised romaine lettuce.  This just knocked my socks off -- tremendous flavor.  Normally by this point in a tasting menu I am leaving half of each plate uneaten, but I scarfed down every bit of this dish.  Just first rate.       Desert was a banana tart with peanut butter flavored ice cream.  They paired this with an Australian port.  What a super combination.  The port had these tastes of brown sugar that just absolutely complemented the desert.  I only ate half the desert because I was stuffed, but I finished every drop of the port.       The food was $65 and the paired wines added $30 -- expensive for Pittsburgh I suspect, but a bargain for a native Washingtonian       I've been to Pittsburgh many times on business and never had better than an "OK" meal.  Now, at last, my quest is over !!

sFMTnhIX0xd708-YLBivcg.text: was treated for my bday.  and man, oh man... was it a treat.    started it with the heirloom tomato salad.  wowza.  and a serious portion too.  the duck salad was great too.  it was like duck bacon.  what more can you ask for?  went on to the seafood tasting and the halibut.  both delicious.  but the real shocker was dessert.  three words for you... fried. peach. pie.

5CA0cYI6IG5lWpbvNrVLcw.text: My husband and I were visiting for our Anniversary and asked the desk where we were staying "The Renaissance" where to have a wonderful dinner....they suggested "Nine on Nine' or "Eleven".   We choose Eleven because when we were walking during the day we passed on our way to the Heinz Museum and stopped in...the decor was nice and the young woman at the front desk informed us the dress was Jacket but no tie needed...classy she said.   So, we booked on line through Yelp.   We arrived but had to wait at the front desk while the same young woman explained to the person where to buy a six pack at some package store.  Then while we were waiting we noticed people where in jeans and no jackets...we where dressed or over dressed at this point.  Finally, seated we did enjoy great service from our wait staff.  The wine was Frog's Leap Merlot which was nice rounded aged wine.  I had the Hudson Valley Foie Gras | $18 Belgian endive, arugula, brioche, persimmon, late harvest vinegar....the Foie Gras was over cooked, large portion but the endive had the right touch of sweetness that it was palatable.    My husband had the Tuna Tartare * | $12caviar, Meyer lemon mignonette, pea tendrils, white anchovy which again, was a nice size portion and my husband enjoyed it.  We both ordered the Roasted Squash & Parsnip Soup | $7crispy parsnip.  It was too spicy for me and my husband attempted to consume both bowls but was too much.  The waiter noted my concern on the spices and took it off  the tab.  We both order for our main Jamison Farm Lamb | $34 smoked shoulder, saddle, lamb bacon, local beets, potatoes, red onion marmalade, mint which was the highlight of this entire meal....cooked perfectly, the lamb bacon such a surprise and delight, along with the smoked shoulder left us completely satisfied...you might say it saved the night~  We had Vanilla Bean Creme Brulee sweet ricotta doughnut, poached pears for dessert which was not as creamy as I like Brulee to be.  Cappuccino and Espresso followed which was a nice finish to our meal.  My husband went to the front desk to ask for a cab to be called.  He had to return three time to order a cab which did not sit well with him.  Overall, the wait staff and actual meal were enjoyable with the highlight being the lamb!  Disappointment on dress code not being True to form and the presence of the front reception person lacked higher standards for a fine dining atmosphere.

9_liMTWa857pVSJN4cz6XA.text: limited lunch menu  excellent service  nice lobster roll  excellent desserts

-NLQmltkmQbX6kCAzfHO1w.text: I'd have to say Big Burrito's take on Contemporary American at Eleven is a success.   I thought my food was very well prepared and delicious. Prior to the start of our meal we were presented with scallops crusted with poppy and seasonings which were really excellent, and to be honest I don't even like scallops very much - they may even have been my favorite part of my entire meal.  I also ordered the three green salad with goat cheese which was really enjoyable albeit not outstanding.  Then again - it was a simple green salad, how memorable can it get? My entree was the seafood tasting which included potato crusted sea scallops, Pacific salmon & jumbo lump crab cakes.  I particularly enjoyed the salmon & crab cakes. For dessert I ordered a creme brulee, which frankly was not very good.  They went to town searing the top.  Way too seared.  Eleven has a wide variety of "designer" cocktails which were all very good. I don't really want to give this restaurant a 4 star rating, but it doesn't deserve three stars either.  It may not have been one of the very best restaurants I have eaten at, but I think for Pittsburgh it is pretty exceptional. I read various reviews and heard many opinions that felt Eleven is rather pricey.  While it may be more expensive than many other restaurants in Pittsburgh, I think it should be noted that Eleven is really rather on par with the pricing of other "hip & new" restaurants in other American cities.

CX1ouvupZ2Of5aU0m6dmdQ.text: I live in Chicago, where I have access to a plethora of excellent restaurants, but Eleven is quite simply my all-time favorite restaurant.  My family and I come here often to celebrate big events - birthdays and new jobs and such.  It's expensive, but very much worth it.   The service staff is very good.  From the hostess who will find you a table even when you forgot to make reservations (although especially on Fri and Sat it's a good idea to have them) to the person who brings around the basket of amazing breads (yeah, there's one person who's primary job is that as far as I can tell) everyone is always friendly and polite.  The server is usually attentive and food and drinks come up quickly, although when I was there most recently they did fall down a bit on that front.  Amusingly, if you have food wrapped up to take home (and if you don't have it in you to eat every bite, then you'll want to do that), they give you a claim ticket for it and you pick it up at the coat check when you leave. Thus, your dining is not disturbed by the sight of leftovers.  My favorite thing to order is the vegetarian tasting menu.  You never know what to expect - it's often the thing on the list that you're least sure of that turns out to be the best.  The soups here are transcendently good and if it weren't a fancy place I would pick my bowl up and lick it clean (actually, I do it anyway to avoid missing a drop of the deliciousness, but my parents won't let me).  Also really great salads and lots of excellent vegetables.  Big Burrito makes a point of buying fresh, local produce, which is not only tasty, but also environmentally conscious - yay! They have a really good selection of wines and cocktails, and the servers are great about helping to chose one that will match your meal. And if you can't make up your mind, they'll let you taste some before you order. Also, you can add a set of wine pairings to the tasting menu for (I believe) $30, which I highly recommend doing.  Each one is always the perfect compliment to the course (the sommelier is obviously another very talented member of the staff), and, if you're like me and still learning about wines, it's a great chance to broaden your horizons. Last, but certainly not least, if you don't order a tasting menu (which includes dessert) make sure you leave room.  The pastry chef here is a genius! Whether you like chocolate, fruit, or cheese at the end of your meal, you will not be disappointed - in fact, you'll probably want to order multiple things.  Plus, many of them come with unusual flavors of ice cream that will raise an eyebrow, at least until you try them and discover that they're perfect! Basically, I can not rave about Eleven enough, so you'll just have to go and experience it for yourself!

XCB5Q4I4fVC9pMtxkCtwag.text: Food and service were very good.  We shared three appetizers and split a strip steak.  The food was prepared well and the service was very good.

rBm5RLw1pqElZh-fJYHZRg.text: Whenever i am in The 'Burgh i must make a stop here! Good selection of wines by the glass and the food is some of the best in the area. I recommend the semolina gnocchi, it's very fresh (i believe they make it daily) and still light despite the butter. A little on the expensive side but well worth it.

jiYqQsh4VZ-n6oO-nuqVTg.text: I've always been a fan of the Big Burrito group (FYI, if you're not on their mailing list, get there ASAP because the birthday coupon/s they send you are well worth it).  Up until recently, I had only eaten at Mad Mex and Soba and really wanted to try the others.  I always knew Eleven was on the more expensive side, but my husband, knowing someone who works there, and having the 'inside' scoop on what to order, we decided to take the plunge, knowing we were in for a $80 dinner for 2 (which turned out to be a good estimation).  Drinks: we got cocktails...Tea-jito and Elev-ade.  Very very very tasty.  Very good.  Appetizer: tuna tartare.   My husband is not the raw fish/tartare type but when he said 'it's your choice honey', I chose it.  Usually I choose to get something I know he likes, but we were at Eleven for gosh sakes...I'm not getting the soft pretzel or perogies. Plus, he needs to eat outside of the box sometimes, and it's my job as a wife to be sure he tries new things.  Anywho...amazingly great.  Not as great as La Casa (which is my all-time favorite) but quite up there.  I'd say if La Casa is a 10, Eleven is a 9.5.  Entrees: Husband was told to get the Eleven burger.  He IS the burger type, and quite the burger connoisseur at that.  He loved it.   I had a bite.  I also loved it.  I should have gotten it too.  Instead, I got the crab cake sandwich.  Don't get me wrong, it was good, but I wouldn't rate it 'Eleven' good.  Maybe I shouldn't have eaten it as a sandwich, but I would rate it as a 7 out of 10.  The whole experience was great, and as pricy as expected.  Only because of my crab cake sandwich would I say that it was only worth slightly less than we paid, but my husband said it was worth every penny.  So overall, I give it a huge thumbs up and we will be going back, but not ordering the crab cake sandwich.

C93RhYXfFq2DeTtoY04GUw.text: Went to Eleven on Mothers Day. We sat down promptly at 10am. Our server was right with us. We both decided that the Pre Fixe Menu was the best way to go. An appetizer, entree & cocktail for $25!! Cant beat that! My mom ordered the scallops app and I ordered the smoked salmon. Both were amazing, although I did like my moms scallops better than my salmon. As our entrees my mom ordered the Mushroom, Sweet Pepper & Goat Cheese Omelet and I ordered the Rock Shrimp, Asparagus, Ham and White Cheddar Omelet. Both were very very good. Again I liked my moms better than mine! For dessert we shared the Creme Brulee, which was out of this world. Over all I loved this place. I would like to go here again and try their dinner.

Lu0uDKBnIy-u5h8E4RlyTQ.text: Had a really nice meal here on a recent visit to Pittsburgh. The swordfish entree was very different but very good. The restaurant is very cool in its architecture and its staff is tip-top. The only problem is the bar which is very loud if you are sitting right above it. I would recommend telling them when you make a reservation that you prefer to be away from the bar.

KcOsrPuD9nw7wmSSMB81cg.text: I was taken out to dinner here by a friend dying to try the place, and by the end of the meal, we were speechless (and drunk, and full). Eleven can box with some of the great restaurants I've been to in Boston, both for its wonderful service and imaginative, delicious food. The menu, which they've aptly dubbed "new American," focused a great deal on local ingredients, which I dig. We ordered a bottle of white, and my friend ordered a seafood tasting while I went for one of the best salmon dishes I've ever had in a restaurant. A Pittsburgh must-eat.

aJJr4lBt9yyjI4yVbfBTiA.text: We went here over the holidays and we had a great time.  I have to admit that my recollection about all the dishes is a bit hazy, but I remember that the overall dining experience was fantastic.  Our group tried a number of appetizers, including a duck taco, tuna sashimi and some of the cheeses.  I was a bit skeptical about the taco, but it was amazing - it had some great flavors.  We went across the board in terms of entrees and all were raved about.  I ordered the lamb after the waiter's suggestion and I'm glad I did.  The mean was perfectly cooked and the polenta was also excellent.  Overall, I would definitely recommedn Eleven to anyone looking for a superb dining experience in Pittsburgh.

q32-FyxeMRLjizBiDK3v3Q.text: I'm a serious foodie and I enjoy trying restaurants all over the world from street carts to 5-star places. Eleven has high aspirations, and amazing interior design. It's a very pretty place and a good choice to impress a date, but if you're there for the food, I'd only give it a "C." While it's carefully prepared and pretty, most things I've tried there were bland, and servings were small. There weren't any tasty sauces on the plate, nor were there even any salt/pepper shakers on the table and it took some effort to get a waiter to bring some. How can diver scallops be bland? That takes some effort. The crab cakes were the only thing we had with some flavor. Anyway, there wasn't anything actually bad in the experience, but the food didn't meet the build-up, the decor, or the descriptions given by some of the other reviewers.

qKa_afVQ4XGtmXd1UkptwA.text: An excellent meal.  I don't know Pittsburgh well, but I'm told that Eleven is the best restaurant in the city.  I would believe that.  However, the service was not a match for the quality of the food.  Rather slow and inattentive, even though the restaurant was not full.  Thus only 3 out of 5 stars.

mAZXUDQFg42W6FL6Pquiug.text: I haven't been to Eleven for a few years.  On the plus side, the restaurant was pleasantly crowded.  When I came a few years ago, the place was empty - never a good sign or a fun atmosphere to dine in.    My complaint about this visit is that Eleven committed a cardinal sin of dining - they let me sit w/ an empty wine glass for about 15 minutes (this is a really long time!).  I felt like there were a bazillion servers and food runners running around the restaurant, but our waiter was MIA.  I finally had to flag down another server and ask him to find our waiter so that I could order more wine.    Our food was good, but not amazing by any standard.  Between the two of us, we had the asparagus soup and the soft shell crab for apps.  For our main courses, we had the NY strip, the crab cakes and the lamb taco.  I was pleased that they didn't give me any flak for ordering 2 apps as my main.  Desserts were key lime creme brulee and the chocolate pretzel dessert.  Dinner was good, but nothing special.

SKw3KL_Z4L89Jyu2tk93vg.text: Their lamb entree was great but they have removed it from the dinner entree selections. If you want to try it, you have to order the chef tasting option which costs a lot more. The lamb taco and seabass were not bad but I have had better else where. Over all i thought this place is over priced and the food was just ok. I was not impressed with this restaurant.

32YNB-QweVKIQXCxVWr9dA.text: Not sure what to expect, but really pleasantly surprised.  Locally sourced food prepared extremely well.  Great space--nice view of the wine cellar--or a clever prop.  Either way, maybe that accounts for why the wine mark-up is so truly staggering--a good 300% or more over retail, completely out of tune with the rest of the food and drink offerings. Good wine list, though.  The markup is the only blemish on an otherwise excellent dining experience.

mWENH3bax8QtYLqtg4cNwQ.text: Maybe my expectations for Eleven were too high. I do love a lot of Big Burrito, and with Eleven billed as "contemporary American," I thought it would be a runaway heart-stealer. Unfortunately, I found the food to be pretentious without any reason to be, boring at best, and occasionally just gross. I'm a vegetarian, so maybe their meat dishes are better. If a restaurat goes so far as to have a veg tasting menu, I'd expect something above average for the veggie diners.The signature drinks seemed exciting on paper, but failed to deliver in person. I do remember the bathroom as luxuriously delightful, though.

FvhNIDbNubx9NSaTHPs-FA.text: Loved it!  The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars was because we only went for happy hour!  We had great soft pretzels and raw oysters with yummy martinis.  Would highly recommend a visit to Eleven.

aIFq4lBVi7yNTounAPO3gQ.text: This time around I ordered the Wild Alaskan Halibut. This dish was amazing and for $34 was not in my opinion overpriced. I loved how all the flavors came together and added flare to the fish, especially the pickled chanterelle and the scallion gnocchi. I wasn't too crazy however about the creme fraiche brulee, which I felt was way too sweet. I did like the creme part and how it went with the raspberries. Honestly, if it wasn't for the dessert I think I might have given the experience 5 stars. However, a 4 star rating is still respectable and certainly enough to warrant future visits.

lGlCHS-FJ_4_YIm6MOzb_A.text: Was in Pittsburgh for a meeting--had an evening "on our own" and a group of 16 headed to dinner at Eleven.  I did make a reservation (but only for 12).  We were seated promptly (and they quickly added the additional spots needed) and Tom (our waiter) handled the group with ease.  The food was extraordinary--everyone raved about their orders, things came out quickly and at the end, Tom had no problem doing individual checks!  It was one of the best group dining experiences I have ever had!  Highly recommend Eleven!!

xc3r4NBPfhlyjlGIR-AR4A.text: I am not sure how the majority of stars is 5 on this restaurant.  If I could give it 0 stars I would.  We got a table upstairs and our waitress Megan came over.  She had 0 personality and you can tell she just wanted to keep making the check more expensive so her tip would be higher.  She didn't even introduce herself, we only knew her name because it said it on the check.  If you are a waitress at a high class restaurant like that one I expect better service.  I ordered the hanger steak and my husband ordered the tagliatelle.  As we waited we were given one slice of bread each.  Was good, but we wanted more because it was so small as if it was a sample.  Our food came, first impression of my hanger steak was this is so small.  Honestly, my hanger steak should of been on the appetizer list, that's how small it was.  My husbands first impression of his tagliatelle was it smelled like semen.  No, I am not trying to be funny it 100% smelt like semen.  I don't know why he tried a bite but he did.  He couldn't eat it, from the smell.  Is this place special sauce semen or something?  Honestly, I don't know how no one has ever said something about it.  My poor husband was sick afterwards, I had to go home and make him and I something to eat. Since his smelt like semen and mine was so small I was still hungry. Never again will I go to this restaurant.  IF YOU HAVE A BIG BURRITO GROUP COUPON GO TO CASBAH 100X BETTER.

gmS1Rout3GLkbbfS97TsJQ.text: I've had brunch here a couple of times and have always enjoyed it.  On what occasion, I had a sweet potato omelet with bacon with a dogfish punkin draft.  It was spectacular especially the omelet.

d-bRbZhjCyvpuAgScCptmw.text: Decor: Almost deserves two stars alone for beautiful vaulted ceilings and the fireplace. It is 11,000 square feet... Get it....Eleven. Food: No complaints, solid food very nicely plated and prepared. Service: Professional waiter. Coat check was polite and swift.   Value: Price was actually really fair for what you get. This is an upscale restaurant that warrants visiting more than once. Extra: I was happy with the valet, the coat check, the hostess, the server, and the food. Now with that being said it was not any more amazing than other restaurants of this caliber. I should probably give it five stars, but Eleven does not have "the its the most amazing restaurant of its kind" vibe.

pvuDh29B26FeQMBt6ze4Xw.text: Been here three times now and each time just continues to outshine the last! The atmosphere is so relaxing and enjoyable. No matter where you're seated, it feels somewhat private yet still populated and lively. The menu is delicious and the wines and cocktails perhaps even more so. The staff is very attentive as well and really interested in making sure you have an enjoyable meal (shocking!). If you've haven't been here yet, GO!

Gy9ltaykTgFgksgvCJ0YcQ.text: We have been to Eleven many times. It is my wife's restaurant of choice for her birthday. Last night's experience was even better than usual, due to having Will as our server. Will may be the best waiter we have ever had. Pleasant, friendly, knowledgeable. Proactive as well.

L7IyRFhJ4wktpQAXhrJvUw.text: Very good food and a very fun atmosphere. The butternut squash soup, oysters, and crab cakes were all extremely delicious. Given it was a busy Saturday night, the service was fairly slow.

Fn7nTDXL16hjF_3gtFAlyg.text: My friend and I have decided to make Pittsburgh a "moms" trip every year, and this past weekend was our second visit. One of the big things we look forward to are really great meals (without the kids, etc.). A few people from home recommended Eleven so we decided to make reservations. For a few days out, there weren't many options for times, but I take that as a good sign. Our reservations were for 9pm on Saturday and we were seated right away, at a large booth, which was nice. Our waitress was very nice at first and very helpful in regards to the wine menu. She went over many of the different options and really pushed a few of the middle of the road bottles, which wasn't a problem. However, as both my friend and I agree that we'd like to spend the most money on food, over wine, we decided to go with a cheaper bottle of cab and and focus our attention on ordering whatever our little hearts desired from the food menu. Our waitress did not seem pleased when we told her our choice of wine; she genuinely seemed put out. I'm not sure if she makes commission from wine sales or if it was just that we didn't take her suggestions, but she didn't seem happy. Her service was fine for the rest of the meal, but she was not nearly as friendly as when we sat down.   Ultimately, our food was wonderful. We both got the beet salad (very good, fresh) and I got the strip, which was cooked perfectly. Great portion sizes and great presentation; I don't think you feel at all that you're paying too much for too little. I'm not sure we will be back, as there are so many great restaurants to try in Pittsburgh, but I'm not at all sad that we went!

pGJdCG2-kRWH9vc9GPRuSA.text: Great dinner and great place to use the big burrito birthday coupon... went on a Wednesday evening with the husband for his birthday.   Great drinks. Appetizers were OK- oysters were tiny / not very flavorful and the heirloom tomato salad was nothing special. Person coming around with bread was all judgey because I asked for a slice of each kind of bread.. sorry I'm not sorry Bread man. Entrees were much better- I got the beef tenderloin which was amazing and husband got swordfish which was really good too. Dessert was incredible- banana pudding and creme brulee. Overall we loved it- cool place!

6yTldH_QoyNdizk5cLY57A.text: Our visit was fairly late on a Thursday night for our anniversary. I ordered the Seafood Tasting, which included salmon, crab cake, sea scallop, and squash and tomato. My fiance had the Elysian Fields lamb, which was tender and full-flavored. I was really happy!

YSMNZvwCPNoFL7WygnQpWQ.text: Went there with my girlfriend to celebrate her birthday.  She wrote the last review and summed it up pretty well.    Let me add some shout outs...  Kudos to Edward who was our server and provided spot on service.  Great work by the kitchen staff!  The food was exemplary.  Extensive wine list!  Had the Mietz Petit Verdot '04...an excellent tasting wine!  I really couldn't have asked for much more in a meal.  I highly recommend Eleven.

3Lt6aiDe-18gB9WG1a9IKA.text: Everything  was awesome start to finish.  Went here to celebrate my wife's  birthday.  Rock shrimp and other appetizers , and meals were delicious and hot.  My wife had the tenderloin, I had the lamb.  Our service was great as well. Tom took great care of us and the whole staff acknowledged my wife's birthday from the moment we check in.   Thank you Eleven for making the dinner special!

QlRfC4fP32BL8UMuDhcXSg.text: The overall theme of Eleven is balance.  The pork belly was like a gift from God: the saltiness of the grits balanced by the sweet maple gastrique; the soft tender pork belly enhanced by the crispy apple slices; and the brown color of the seared belly offset by the bright greens.  Truly a perfectly conceived dish.  Did I mention that it tasted AMAZING?  The scallops were the only thing that didn't blow my mind.  They were good, just not out of this world.  My main dish was hands down the best lamb dish I've ever had.  If you like lamb, get the lamb.  Again, perfectly balanced.  The lamb, smoked shoulder, mint, lamb bacon, and red onion marmalade could all be tasted in different combinations.  You could make every bite different and every bite equally amazing.  Perfectly cooked, perfectly executed, and beautiful to look at.  Finally, there's a reason the chocolate-peanut-pretzel candy bar is at the top of their dessert menu.  This is not your kid's Snickers bar, THIS IS YUMMY TIME FOR ADULTS.  It all comes together and again, is perfectly balanced.  The cold sweet ice cream, the salty smooth peanut/preztel filling sitting on a thin dense brownie (acted almost like the crust).  Truly an incredible finish to an amazing meal.  The service was outstanding and probably the most personable service I've ever had.  Our waiter Daniel was extremely courteous, informative, nice, and helped make our night one to remember.

9pbN2fHfLxcIl2plyHW1Kw.text: Seriously!  All you happy hour gurus like me, listen up!!  They have updated their happy hour menu so that now you can get ANY gin or vodka martini for $6.  This includes Belvedere, Boyd and Blair, etc.  It used to just be Stoli but now it's anything.  My jaw dropped.  This is HANDS DOWN the best happy hour in Pittsburgh!!  Not to mention the dynamic menu (changing weekly) and array of good wine, cocktails and food (oysters!) on HH.  I've also had dinner here twice.  They send out birthday coupons if you are on their mailing list for a free entree (up to $30 value).  Hello!  This is killa.  I used mine in Dec.  A friend emailed Big Burrito saying she didn't receive hers and they faxed a letter to the restaurant for her free dinner a month later.  Best customer service.  I really can't say enough good things about this place.

N3EDDO3FY7EsnKVbOy6vug.text: I have gone to Eleven for a long time. The first thing you will notice is the service is always great. The environment is very comfortable yet classic. You can go in jeans or get dressed up.  As for the food I have found most dishes are quite good even if the portions tend to run small.  I do hate it when the change the menu and take someone off I really like but at least it they do change. The seafood sampler is a must try. I don't love the mussels as they just didn't have enough flavor but the sausage pretty good. I do recommend soaking the bread cubes in the sauce they are amazing.

D99Q9CmrSyUx2_jVP5OCIw.text: This is the kind of place you can bring a foodie for dinner. The service was excellent, although I would have preferred to have someone on hand who could  better help with a wine selection. Everything we ordered was excellent. We started with PEI oysters, which were clean and served with a spicy habanero sauce (spicy by midwest standards, at least). We ordered the seafood medley and an AK halibut, both of which were quite good. The only knock is the cleaning of the scallop, which wasn't as we would have expected. The blueberry pie dessert was reasonably sized and quite flavorful.  I would definitely bring friends, colleagues, or a date here again.

N8KHqv7rFFikEpodMZKAgA.text: If you are out for a date or a meeting, this is a good place. Decent food, nice service, quiet environment, people dress up, valet parking.   I ate here twice -- one for free and another paid, but I probably wouldn't make this a first choice for another fun dining experience, unless on special occasions. The food tastes great but is also pretty standard. I felt I paid mostly for the formality here.  In summary, this is a great place to find out -- best with a reason. The establishment is quite impressive and memorable.

BkxdGgZY9WIX_Ehs8mgPTA.text: I think Eleven must have been renovated from an abandoned warehouse. While the space itself is large, airy, and exposed, it's been redesigned to be very chic and trendy. Our larger party was escorted to the second level into one of the private rooms for our meal.  As I oft do when somebody else is paying, I quickly gravitated towards the most expensive items on the menu. For this go around, it was the foie-gras appetizer, beef tenderloin (ok this was second most, but I love beets and horseradish). As can be reasonably expected with any foie gras dish, it represented completely over-the-top decadence, and I Ioved every bite of it. Melt in your mouth and the brioche had just enough crunch and texture to complement the rich treat. Tenderloin was also cooked to perfection and SO TENDER I wanted to cry (and probably did a little). I ordered the sorbet for dessert (since somewhere along the way I've convinced myself that eating sorbet is tantamount to a 3-4 mile job), but regretted not ordering the peanut-pretzel candy bar that my neighbors ordered. Next time!

NixOfcIm3enj3vlSvT1jwQ.text: I will admit I have not dined in the full restaurant side, but I have dined several times in the Tavern Side as I have been there for business...  and every time the food has been fantastic. Although they have a few constants on there - such as the Eleven Burger, which is less of a Burger and more of an experience - the menu tends to change depending on what they can source and that is a good thing.  The Service is good -  most of the time very personable and I am glad I came - even wishing I could stay a while - but normally I have to drive back to wherever I am staying.  but the odd occasion, I get a waiter who is full of himself and is doing you a favor by serving you. Eleven is clearly a place "to be seen" and the staff seem to know that.  The only other thing is their beer selection - I understand they are all about locally sourced produce and craft beers, but it wouldn't harm to have a few beers on hand that I may have heard of. I am not suggesting that they start pouring Bud Light - Anything but! But I would love it if they had some European Brews on hand, such as Chimay.  A great place to go for a nice night out - no matter which side of the premise you are dining on.

KOEgNvM4keL2YHow-YTLsg.text: So a friend insisted that I try Eleven, but I was always a little put off by the fact that it was owned by the same people who own Mad Mex (okay, kind of bland) and Soba (decent, overpriced). However, the GF and I actually woke up in time for lunch on Sunday, and we weren't really in the mood for typical brunch food, so we tried out Eleven.  The ambiance is really nice. It kind of gives off a hotel-lounge feel (for Sunday brunch, at least), and it's relaxed yet classy. I'm also a big fan of the seating arrangement.  We both got the brunch prix fixe, which is $25 for an appetizer, an entree, and a drink. I got a Bloody Mary, the crab cake, and spaghetti with shrimp, crab, lobster, and lima beans. Everything was good, but not superb. Dessert (not included in the prix fixe) was good, but I'm not really a dessert person, so I don't remember what I got.  Now, the food was all pretty good, but the show stopper was actually the bread. They freshly bake everything on the premise, and each bread basket has tiny scones, blueberry muffins, croissants, and I think an orange cranberry bread. I'm told it changes daily based on what the baker decides on making, but everything I had was top notch. Seriously, it sounds kind of stupid, but I would actually go to Eleven just for the bread. They could have charged me $10 for each basket, and I would not have minded at all.  I wasn't sure whether to give Eleven a 4 or a 5, and I really wish Yelp did half-stars, but I ultimately decided to bump it up to a 5, because the bread really is THAT good. All in all, one of my Top 3 restaurants in Pittsburgh.

26s12QHGzT2oo6i329-IHA.text: This is a great Pittsburgh spot if you are forced to eat out in Pittsburgh. They carry my favorite Canadian ice wine which, to date, I have never been able to find on any menu in this Midwestern city. Although, there have been two occasions when I tried to order it and they informed me that they were out of stock. Very lame, very Pittsburgh. Not a lot of vegan options, but the chef is always willing to make something if you let him know. I love the seats outside in the front because my puppy is usually with me (and hungry!) For my omnivorous friends who have never been here, I usually recommend the new york strip steak with pierogies...very Pittsburgh-esque. Overall, a decent place to eat if you're in Pittsburgh.

m7SZ--yFMJ0odgicPY-lKA.text: One of the nicer eateries in Pittsburgh, comes at a steep price though. I felt some of our waiters were a bit douchy and pretentious at first. If you look under 25 and somebody from your party wants to order a cocktail, be prepared to show *everyone's* IDs. On the good side, they were very good about accommodating our giant party of 16 ( even if it was 6pm on a Wednesday night)   Before bringing out our food, we got these little sandwiches with onions and salmon caviar - tasty! Then came our oysters, from Long Island, served with a nice, spicy pepper sauce and some milder one. For main course, I tried the beef tenderloin, pork chop, and tuna. I ordered the beef medium and it came nicely red on the inside, leaning towards medium-rare which worked fine for me since that's what I usually go with anyway. The fingerling potatoes were a tad undercooked and hard. The pork chop was served on bacon grits, and that was the best part of that dish. The pork chop itself was bland and boring. Tuna was alright, nothing special.  For dessert, I had apricot semifreddo covered with somekindofdarkberry syrup drizzle, it was ok - tasty ice cream.

mOsLn9B6rSpUoHsNgmygxQ.text: As good as it gets (in Pittsburgh)!  I've gone back, and this time the service was really on point.  The steak was prepared *perfectly* and the portion was so huge I have enough left for lunch tomorrow.  The crab cake appetizer was one of the best I've had, and the dessert (as always) was outstanding.  It's a bit pricey, but portion sizes are reasonable and it's a nice dining experience.  When company comes in town, or it's hot date night, this is the first place I'll go.

6HFUNBr6xu-8Z_e2-qIobA.text: We highly recommend Eleven for hosting parties, events, et al.   We held our rehearsal dinner earlier in June this year in their private room (upstairs).  We all had an excellent five course dinner.  Courses included soft shell crab, a proscuitto salad with fresh fruit, and perfectly cooked lamb.   Our out of town guests and guests from the Burgh raved about the presentation of each of the courses.  They also loved sampling 3 different desserts for their final course.  Eleven went above and beyond by printing menus for each our guests and placing on each place setting.   It was a nice gesture and a pleasant surprise (we didnt ask the restaurant to do so).    We had fun reading the descriptions as each course was served.    The restaurant even created a unique four course vegetarian childs dinner.   The waitstaff was pleasant, accomodating to unique and specific requests, and even played with my 18 month cousin during their down moments.    We had a excellent meal and a great time at our rehearsal dinner.

TFNJQ98OTNd7DbeO2ikNaw.text: Nice atmosphere and food was good. I'm use to Philadelphia restaurants so I did expect a little nicer then what I experienced in what is considered a top 5 Pittsburgh restaurant. Service was good. I would go back for drinks but would try another place for dinner.

zDEUXi92vbSQ6_vtMDaoZA.text: My husband and I visited for our first time in Pittsburgh. We were adventurous and ordered the scallop appetizer, neither of us had ever tried them. It was pretty, not a texture I loved but that's not their fault, of course. It came with a small tasty salad. While waiting for food, we were offered some bread. I loved the tomato focaccia! My husband sprung for the steak, which was the most amazing steak either of us have ever tried. The only steak he has eaten without A1. It was served with parmesan potato tots which were fun and delicious. My pork chop was so juicy and beautiful! Turns out I do not like beets and there were quite a few on the plate, but it also came with two of the most amazing onion rings. It only had 3 slices of grilled peach slices, which I was looking forward to more. On to dessert. OMG! We got the banana cream pie. It is not your ordinary banana cream pie! It is heaven on a plate. The only downfall was that my husband ordered a Pepsi, and for each refill, we were charged $3.50. So over $10 for 3 small glasses of an alcohol free beverage. Bummer that we weren't informed. But overall we had a wonderful experience thanks to the fantastic food and our excellent server, Margaret. And to top it off, at the very end of our meal, we were brought two squares of salted caramels which was awesome. It was a lovely dining experience, but even so, the prices were steep.

photos.caption: Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Banana cream pie... Favorite bite ever?
Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pork chop with peaches and best onion rings ever
Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Strip steak with parmesan tots. So amazing

yDiUD7mI6Zw9_96Je4520w.text: I was in Pittsburgh for my girlfriends birthday and wanted to take her out somewhere nice. After doing some research I came across Eleven and made reservations. I couldn't have been happier with the experience.  I made the reservation on open table and noted that it was her birthday and requested any seating with a nice view or other differentiator if they had it. We walked in and were promptly seated in a nice private booth that overlooked the downstairs bar. Our waiter was very friendly and knowledgable. He checked on us often, but not too often. I also appreciated that he mentioned my girlfriends birthday without bringing out the waitstaff to sing or any other annoying show.  The food was excellent as well. They brought around breads, and the salt focaccia was delicious. I had the beef tenderloin and she had the roasted chicken. The beef was great and the fingerling potatoes that came with it may be the best potatoes I've ever had. I had a few bites of her chicken as well and it was equally as good. For desert we had the chocolate peanut butter candy bar and it was amazing. They even went out of their way and wrote happy birthday on a separate piece of chocolate for my girlfriend.  Overall eleven was a great experience and I would certainly recommend it to anyone. A class act staff and delicious food.

ZyP16Nk_e-fy_eH5aJ-NqA.text: From the atmosphere and the service to the entrees and drinks, this restaurant was the perfect place to celebrate my anniversary.   Our waiter was very attentive and knowledgeable on the menu items. I appreciate that he gave us an honest opinion when we asked for suggestions. We had the scallops and pork belly for an appetizer and the lamb and beef tenderloin for dinner. The scallops practically melted in your mouth (and just to note, I don't like seafood!) and the pork belly flavors complemented each other well. My tenderloin was cooked to a perfect medium rare and tasted amazing. I'm not a huge fan of lamb, but my husband devoured his dish and said it was the best tasting lamb he's ever had. My drink of choice was a glass of Cabernet and my hubby had a lemon drop martini. Their wine list is a little pricey for the common folk like me (my glass of wine was $16 and many of their bottles started around $80), but hey, it was my anniversary. Finally, we finished off our meal with their peanut butter pretzel dessert, which was out of this world good. If you're in any way a fan of peanut butter, you should definitely try this dessert!  This was by far one of the best "special occasion" dinners I've ever had.  I certainly can't afford to go here every night (if only!), but I'll definitely be back!  Quick note: For any girls out there wondering what to wear - I wore jeans and a nice top and my hubby wore jeans with a nice sweater and I didn't feel like we were out of place at all.

9GQZsDgtswx2Coqdepla6w.text: The staff and our waiter were polite and knowledgeable of their menu items. The food was wonderful, fresh, and really hit the taste buds. We shared two appetizers and split the main event. Both very good, portion size versa price, I am leaning to portion a little low and price a bit high. All in all a good time.

hSuE4NsohFGXm70BmnU_YQ.text: This is a beautiful space. The food is not very good.  The waiter assured us that the kitchen perfectly cooked meat. My medium burger didn't have a trace of pink; my friend's medium steak was bloody. Then there were the pierogies, covered with caramelized onions, sweeter than any onions I have ever tasted, as sweet as corn syrup.  Yuk, yuk and yuk.  To top it off, the wait staff couldn't even keep my glass full.  It went empty and sat there at least twice.  My friend is a 'foodie.' He paired the too-sweet pierogies with some prosciutto and declared, 'I get what they're trying to do.'  Maybe food can be art, but I don't want food that makes me think.  I want food that tastes good.  I don't think that's a lot to ask.

JK96lopPmiEDGZDBnREzZQ.text: I felt like a pretty pretty princess after dinner here. Goat cheese divine. Oysters scrumptious. That goddamn fried egg salad took me over the edge. I haven't even gotten to the main course- the lamb so perfectly rare. This was one of my favorite meals out on the town in Pittsburgh and this is coming from someone that declares "white people food" to be bland and boring. Food was excellent and service the same. Someone take me back!

iD4-VOSaMyOHScevfmquZQ.text: We just finished our meal here. Every course was delicious , the staff was friendly and prompt. Our server , Joe was great! Will be back again!

OTYyyF0-ap8gKmelv5EK4w.text: Had the seafood trio and the clams.  I wasn't sure at first about the clams, but as they cooled, they had great flavor.  Was very pleased with the seafood trio. Cool Atmosphere!

S4Rs-57D4GMfWDpUk9NBdA.text: I went on a Sunday - A fair amount of people present, but not too crowded.  It was a nice open atmosphere, but pretty quiet, which allowed for easy conversation.  The service was good, and the food was excellent.  I had the pork shank, which tasted very good by itself, but combined with the risotto that came with it - it was excellent.  She had the salmon over cauliflower, which she liked very much as well.  This was an excellent first date choice.

CRMUmtJhfFOEgT8z-X439g.text: Did the Chef's Tasting Menu. Great dining experience. Grilled Swordfish with hot Italian sausage, mussels, and cous cous was one of the best things I have ever eaten. Cool ambience and great service. Top Notch.

G6qNpfbPyAWIthcQOgk50g.text: We had the Chef's tasting menu with wine pairing in August, so this review may be a bit out of date as their tasting menus are seasonal.  The highlight of the meal for me was the lamb-- perfectly cooked and seasoned.  The low point was the tuna tartare--no citrus made it pretty bland.  The wine pairings were excellent.  I'm not typically a fan of wine blends, but those they chose were really tasty.  Although I only gave it 3 stars, I would go back to try another tasting menu...

7yog0oVC85KZfdkED4Cogw.text: After trying a few of the other Big Burrito restaurants, I finally got around to the 'flagship'.  I arrived early (about 15 minutes before 5 PM), and the valets were kind enough to park my car for free since they weren't set up yet.  Off to a good start!    When I got inside, the floor wasn't open yet, so I settled in the bar and was attended to (mostly) by the bartender, although he was understandably distracted with setup.  I settled in the corner with a book and a glass of iced tea, and the tea was fixed perfectly... rarer than one might think, here in the frozen north.  The restaurant itself is GORGEOUS; whoever decorated this space deserves an award.  It is well lit without being bright, warm without being twee, and elegant without being uncomfortable.  All in all an absolutely beautiful place to eat.  Upon getting a table, the wait staff was very attentive... another plus.  My waitress was superb, always being there at the precise moment I needed her, never intrusive.  All this, despite my being the only person at my table - and I know all too well how much restaurants hate single diners.  Rebekah, you were phenomenal.  So why three stars?  Well... all the things I have mentioned were each a star.  Unfortunately, the food was very forgettable.  I ordered the shrimp and grits appetizer.  Presentation was impeccable, but the shrimp were jumbo shrimp and tough as boot leather.  They were served on a thin layer of something creamy (presumably grits, though not like any I'd ever seen) and some collards that tasted decent but were almost tougher than the shrimp.  Tastewise the dish was acceptable (although far from delicious), but texturewise it was a total wreck.    So... on to the main course.  I ordered gnocchi, which is one of my favorites.  The gnocchi themselves were homemade and quite good.  The dish was served with mushrooms, baby lima beans and spinach, and again, the greens were ridiculously tough.  The mushrooms had a wonderful flavor, but the texture of bubblegum.  Once again, presentation won out over edibility... I don't get the impression that anyone in the kitchen actually eats any of the dishes they prepare, or else they would realize that taste and texture are even more important than being pretty.  Dessert was a pineapple cake, which was delicious and served with a very tart, sour sorbet.  The sweetness of the cake and the tartness of the sorbet were well matched, and this would have been a definite five-star dessert except for the presence of... crystallized ginger?!  Who thought this added something to the flavors of this dish?  I think it must have been put on the dish for decoration, but a piece of this in your mouth at the wrong time would definitely stomp on all the other flavors.  All in all, this is a wonderful space; the staff is excellent; if they get a chef who learns how to serve food people actually eat instead of look at, it will truly be a 5+ star experience.  As it is?  An excellent place to see and be seen... not to eat.

-mlxLSdXiUochETrX4CW-g.text: Overpriced w/ very average food. Past it's prime.

Z2Z1JmJojrIKOoh7xtNkaQ.text: Seriously awesome. The bar is great, the service is so personable. And the food was incredible. We had the Pittsburgh rare meat and the crab cake and they were so delicious!  The atmosphere is perfect too, with great tables kind of separated and really cozy booths. Great lighting. I highly recommend.

wprDpVAqvheZCvZ-4Dmd_g.text: Fantastic again. Love the elegant yet casual atmosphere.    Here is to you, Eleven, for great service and food!    Wait staff was so good, quiet, removed plates after each course and replace your utensils with each course.  Refilled your water after each course with ice cold water but without ice, a nice touch.    The food and preparation was perfect.  We shared a couple of appetizers.  The Spicy Tuna Tartare with avocado, pea tendrils and sambal was very tasty, maybe a tad to much sambal but still very good.  The Potato Gnocchi with smoked pork, English peas, jalapeno, mint was top notch with a definite mint flavor.  The Three Greens salad with red pepper goat cheese, and lentil vinaigrette was fresh and tasty.  My entree of Lamb Loin was cooked perfectly.  Always have a memorable meal at Eleven.

sfXFCTMHqqzVoAyxjursDA.text: I stopped her for a birthday brunch with my wife and could not have been more pleased with our choice. We arrived just as they were opening for brunch and got a table right away. We did the brunch deal which included a drink appetizer and breakfast. It was a bit more than we'd typically pay for a brunch but it seemed like a bargain for all that we got. Everything was fantastic! The chef also sent out a treat for my wife's birthday! We can't wait to come for brunch again soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Steak and eggs

OxRpL3amT4SbHXh2iA8P1g.text: We went there for brunch on a Sunday. It was a great experience- very delicious! Highly recommend!   I was impressed by the presentation of the courses we got, starting with the bread basket on the house. For appetizers, got the beignets and pork belly. Highly recommend the pork belly. The beignets were excellent as well.   Main course I got the steak and eggs. The steak was cooked medium rare as asked for and very rich in flavor. A nice touch was the fried egg on top.   Cocktails are also excellent. Loved the maple smash and will definitely get again in the future.

ATTOB9bVI4DkKwZ0baF7nw.text: This is perhaps my fave restaurant out of all the Big Burrito Group restaurants. I went for brunch today and chose the pre fixe menu. It is honestly best deal - $29 for a cocktail, appetizer and entree. I started off with a mimosa and had the Cantaloupe and Cucumber soup. The soup was delicious and a nice departure from the Three Green Salad I always get it. It is also not made with dairy products so it's light! For my entree I chose the Eleven Burger with white cheddar cheese. I knew I was getting the burger before even coming to the restaurant and as always it does not disappoint! I ended up taking half of it home with me which will make for a nice lunch tomorrow!

oMd_dNF8s2qCNJEOFQP8Rg.text: great place for dating.  I hope to have a girlfriend to go with... Anyway, not a bad place to try.

9PkONbp0TJx-oBVBdRvj-g.text: Had burger and salad on the side Salad was Gross Burger got me so sick. Still feeling like puking hours later. So disappointed

eJFm03uqQR9X5vqhRkAbcg.text: I had an epic time at Eleven the other night for dinner. We were greeted by friend staff, and taken up a staircase to our seat, just across from the enormous glass enclosed wine cellar. We ended up splitting the rigatoni mixed with butternut squash and kale, sprinkled with pecorino romano cheese as an appetizer, which was fantastic! I had trouble ordering the main course since there were so many delicious sounding options, but went with the seafood sampler. My favorite was the scallops and sword fish, absolutely delicious! I was also able to appreciate a bite of the beef tenderloin, which was so soft and easy to chew, a must for my type of meat! We topped it off with ice cream and the creme brulee. Highly recommend this place !

TmC0ErAGw_hp0dZVZT3ShA.text: We went here for their special spring tasting menu and were not disappointed! We went on a Sunday so it wasn't busy. I was able to find parking in the lot across the street and my BF found street parking. I anticipate it is a bit harder during the busy times, but they do offer Valet Parking, which is nice. The hostess was very friendly as well as the bartender. The ambiance is very sleek and nice. Makes for a nice place for a date, family dinner or just a get together with friends. Our waiter was very friendly and knowledgeable. Every course of our meal was better than the one before, if that's possible! We had a lovely date night and left full, but not stuffed like a turkey on Thanksgiving. We'll definitely be back!

P86gLD97wzX9d8up8b2DZQ.text: This is a nice place for a business dinner or romantic dinner, they have a great brunch as well. It is nicely placed close to downtown at the end of the Strip District. They source from local farms and their proteins from chicken to steak are excellent.

TSLUtycHdUr7Wyx5kjhqFQ.text: The atmosphere is really inviting and relaxing. I went for a lunch woth a friend. Everything sounded deliocus and great bar too. I had the veal sandwhich, my friend had the lobster roll. Which was filled with lobster very creamy and delicious. My veal sandwhichs was good but the veal was dry and too much bread for the sandwhich. I would say the ceaser salad was better. I would go back for that lobster roll. For dessert we got creme brulee it was creamy and not too sweet. Perfect. Since it was her birthday they came out with chocolates they made. The only thing I would say was service was very slow.

NucUc9tOW1hCLnhzsimALw.text: Pretty good vibe. Corner booths and upstairs is where it's at. Real tasty flavors in creative ways- great mix of textures. Some Tasty seafood dishes. Bunch of classics with their own unique twist. Mixed drinks are also notable. I've noticed the staff can be a little hurrying, but they're probably also over assigned. I never really say no to suggestions to est here. Ice cream is bomb.

JhUq9iX8ugj9RNhlW9kUWA.text: Drinks were on point. The salmon was absolutely delicious, the best I ever had. Service was great. The summer vegetable salad was also one of the tastiest salads I had in a while. Need to go back!

j44I1jJBbzrZ5fern9FnnA.text: Great drinks at the bar! They can make a great Manhattan and the bar food isn't just your typical bar food , it's top notch! Great place to meet a date and hang out at the bar.

jiS0hoj1L6g-eqciVL2lTQ.text: Nathan was stellar! He recommended delish selections from the farm to table menu.  Delectable roasted carrots, fresh beet salad, organic roasted chicken ... and desserts to finish off a perfect and joyful dinner. Thank you Nathan!

-fLTK12aXszPWXRtmetPMg.text: Stopped by here for happy hour after visiting the Heinz History Center next door to wait out traffic. It's a very dark but classy atmosphere with a nice bar a seating area. The happy hour is a $7 menu with select drinks and appetizers. I tried the cucumber mule which was very crisp and refreshing with fresh cucumber and ginger. I also ordered the calamari from the happy hour menu which was quite delicious a the portion was great for the happy hour price.  I finished with a dirty martini which you have free selection of you gin on during happy hour. This was a pleasant surprise and a welcome one indeed. On my visit it appeared that care was taken behind the bar when crafting drinks which is something I look for. I don't want drinks just sloshed together and thrown in front of me. The presentation goes a long way. This seems like it would be a nice romantic date night spot and I look forward to coming back.
