IT4SPR1mKIArWMnE9rXqNg.text: Besides Umi, one of the only Big Burrito restaurants that still has excellent food and spot on service. The Brunch is terrific, cocktails are great, food, and service are perfect.

8_BEstr4yhw-oRgo8cm6Qw.text: Went here with my fiance tonight for our Valentine's Day dinner. We booked our table via opentable, and had to wait about 10 minutes for a table once we got there.  We were seated upstairs in a small 'private' section with 4 other tables of two each. It was a nice quiet area to be seated at.  My fiance had the vegetarian Vday tasting menu, while I had the crab cake appetizer and the beef tenderloin with bone marrow for my main. The crab cake was disappointing - we often go to Monterey Bay on Mount Washington for what we think of as superb crab cakes - so this was really very underwhelming taste wise. Not sure what kind of crab was used here. Although, the presentation was great with fingerling potatoes and a delicious sauce. The beef tenderloin came very medium rare, and was very tasty. The dish as a whole was good, although the jus on the bone marrow was a bit too salty for me, and the cheese that was served with the dish did not really complement the other flavors of the dish as a whole. My fiance's tasting menu was great from the start. The sweet potato soup and the risotto were the best parts, but as a whole, all tasting portions very well presented and tasty.   For dessert, my fiance had the lemon cheesecake with his tasting menu and I had the spice cake. The spice cake was amazing! Not too sweet, and the ice cream and other elements went together perfectly! The cheesecake was also great - again not too sweet and overwhelming. Due to a mix up with our order by our server, we also got a 'free' black forest cake from the non-vegetarian tasting menu. It was also very good, but the best of all three was definitely the spice cake.  Our server was the only one serving our table in that area, while the other four tables were served by another server who was very passionate, enthusiastic and very professional. We wished we had him! Our server was bad right from the start - his demeanor and customer service was completely off - and he screwed up our dessert order and neglected us throughout the dinner. He also 'forgot' to have bread sent to us, and cleared my unfinished cocktail without asking. I do not want to say more as I don't think his service should be representative of the restaurant as a whole.   I want to give this place a 4 for the food and a 1 for the service (based on the server that we got tonight) but I will be fair and give him and the restaurant the benefit of the doubt.   So I guess, to summarize, great food that's worth a try, though I can't guarantee all choices will be perfect. Prices of food were standard for a restaurant like this, but the cocktails are more expensive than usual.

photos.caption: Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Beef tenderloin main course
Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Risotto with grains (Valentine&#39;s day tasting menu
Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Asian salad (Valentine&#39;s Day vegetarian tasting menu)

z9TuvUgRwMlqZHZTXaL0Xg.text: One of the best restaurants in Pittsburgh. Located in an old micro brewery on the edge of downtown and the Strip District, Eleven serves up one of the best menus in the city. The Chef deserves a Michelin Star for the flavors and presentation of the various dishes. The bar is excellent and the service fine.

JRiaLI3HS3dZiHjNOzQ3cw.text: Amazing food! Amazing service! I was so very fortunate to spend my birthday dinner there. I had the seafood tasting platter and my fiance had the steak and fries! Our waitress Natalie was very knowledgeable and recommended  the best wine and food.

photos.caption: Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Delicious dessert
Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Delicious!

rE4O6LDXL2Di3MqW5s33dA.text: One of the top must try restaurants of Pittsburgh.  I have been to Eleven twice. The first time was last summer for a small Yelp Happy Hour. During this visit I tried the famous Eleven Burger (braised veal, bacon, onions, fries with your choice of white cheddar, Maytag Blue or goat cheese) I got it with everything on it and white cheddar. It was delicious! The fries that came with it were very tasty as well. I also had a few Leven-ades (orange vodka, homemade lemonade and raspberries).   On the second visit I took my wife for lunch for her birthday. I had previously made reservations though the Open Table app and let them know it was her birthday. She had the Lobster Roll and I had the Hanger Steak & Fries. She loved it! I did steal a bite of it and it was one of the best I had ever tasted. The lobster was fresh and tasted like it was just caught that day. My Hanger Steak was very good also.  After we finished she was presented with their chocolate, peanut, pretzel candy bar. (brownie, peanut butter mousse, peanut brittle, pretzel and milk chocolate ice cream) It even had a piece of chocolate on top that said Happy Birthday! It was one of the best desserts I have ever had and is worth every penny! Not to be missed!  Service was wonderful as well. Needless to say, when we left we were stuffed.

r__RfnvqwR3P1WJJ4ZO_Yg.text: It was good. I'm not from the local area, but it was a nice place to try. Memorable for sure.

J2Ao-U02c40Wl5gM0nfzeA.text: I dot get out 5 stars unless the restaurant made my day. This place made my day.   We went there for brunch. Convenient valet parking. Wonderful atmosphere. We ordered their Brunch Prix Fixe. Amazing price for all of food you get.   The Pork Belly was one of the better breakfast foods that I've ever had. The Grilled Sticky was worth every calorie. Both of our entrees were delicious.   What really capped the experience was the service. Our server, Brett, was a super nice guy. He helped us navigate a menu where everything looked delicious. As we were traveling 4 hours home and had full stomachs, he packaged up what was left of our Grilled Sticky, added some plastic silverware, and sent us on our way. Great service, great food, really good prices.

photos.caption: Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Grilled Sticky. I don&#39;t think it&#39;s fat free. But I don&#39;t think I&#39;ve ever cared less.

Y7AHABdi12iC5dyiGHLTmw.text: This review is for the prix fixe brunch, $29 for a cocktail, appetizer and entree. It's a great deal, and everything I've sampled has been delicious. The Bloody Mary is actually spicy which is appreciated. This time I got the oysters (6 pieces) and the steak and eggs. My friend got the short rib hash and bacon burger. We were both satisfied with the portions and the food. I like the variety they have on the menu, especially if you didn't want to pick between a sweet and savory brunch you could get one of each! Will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Steak and eggs
Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bacon burger
Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Brunch menu #2

sB4hI2zghebq7Ub2-DFuBw.text: Five-star experience for their happy hour! Went on a Friday afternoon after work and got seats outside on their little patio. Shared a delicious malbec while munching on 3 different types of cheeses served with bread, savory crackers, pecans and honey. Perfect cheese platter (see pic). Then shared their fried cheese - amazing! Looking forward to next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fried cheese, yes please!!!
Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. This cheese platter....couldn&#39;t have enjoyed more!!
Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Malbec

4WugUELWxuSXLCFa-jGEHQ.text: I'm going to update this review again shortly with a more thorough one but wanted to say that I still consider Eleven to be one of the absolute best restaurants in Pittsburgh.  Their lobster roll brings tears to my eyes and the service is always perfection.

-GoOB-a9PnqHjoxt0lxrQg.text: OMG. The brunch! The brunch! The brunch! I couldn't have asked for a better birthday celebration! We each ordered a different appetizer: the duck confit, the smilies salmon, the squash bisque, or the charcuterie plate. My taste buds were exploding!   I had the Eleven Burger for my entree. Dear Lord in Heaven. This juicy, made-to-perfect meat, topped with goat cheese and crispy onions danced with me until it was done. The fries were...fries.   Four stars? The service. Slow, boring. That's my only negative.

photos.caption: Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

PcvPhI5SbwYd0E6J-_vBVQ.text: I was there last night with my husband and let me tell you this place is amazing! We sat at the bar and planned on staying for one drink. That changed quickly due to our bartender Brian P. He was awesome! Really friendly, full of knowledge and seemed like a great guy! He helped with drink choices and wine choices. We ended up staying a few hours and ordered the scallops, which also were amazing! Cooked perfectly, juicy and full of flavor. If you're in town go see Brian P! He will help you out and make you feel at home!   Thanks again Brian for helping us out and being so kind!

wbC1KHCt2RbxQMaVsC4ZHw.text: Outside of Kaya, Eleven is the most consistent restaurant in the Big Burrito Group. Contemporary American food in a modern and relaxing setting. Comfortable seating, unique 2 floor design with great tables for large or small parties.  Brunch offers up a $39 pre fixe menu which includes an appetizer, entree and alcoholic beverage. The Bloody Mary is perfectly spicy and I've had some great brunch meals here including oysters, vanilla waffles, omelettes, and a delicious sticky bun. Meal comes with fresh bread and butter/jam.  For the real experience though, you have to come for dinner. Expertly crafted cocktails, nice wine menu, and a decent beer list - although their beer selection could definitely use improvement. I've been here for special occasions almost a dozen times and haven't been disappointed. My go-to is the different iterations of the bone-in pork chop with varying sides.

H_g7_nROxfL4Nefdxi054A.text: Still amazing....  For me, this is the best upscale restaurant in Pittsburgh. The people are always friendly, the atmosphere is always great, and the food is always perfect.  This time around, my friend and I shared the tuna tartare, and I had a few oysters to start. They were both fresh and perfectly prepared. For my entree I had the roasted chicken. It's simple in theory but it was so flavorful. Loved the risotto, loved the Swiss chard, and loved the chicken!   I just can't visit this restaurant enough! I will be back soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Martini
Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Oysters and tuna tartare
Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Salmon

R5g32mpyVYqjww9A086frg.text: I don't often give 5 star reviews, but I can't think of a thing that would make Eleven better.  The atmosphere is upscale but not stuffy, the staff was amazing and of course the food wonderful. Our visit was fairly late on a Wednesday night but staff welcomed us warmly and worked together seamlessly to make our time there fun.  They have a really nice wine list, too (Yeah!)  Because it was fairly late, we ate lite.  I ordered the Kale Ceasar and as a huge fan of white anchovies, I wished that there were more than two but the salad was crisp and perfect.  My husband had the steak frites entree.  The steak was cooked to order and the fries were crispy and hot.   Such a lovely surprise as we wandered around downtown Pittsburgh!

X_PDpUau78dbLMLiVFYuEg.text: I've been to Eleven twice. This is definitely one of the best restaurants in Pittsburgh. If you want some awesome Modern American food, Eleven will never let you down.   I went here with two of my best friends for Sunday brunch. We had three different appetizers, including oysters, salmon, and a cheese platter. All the food is prepared beautifully. My entree is steak and egg. The fried egg is my favorite part of the dish. Steak is juicy and absolutely delicious.  The ambience in the restaurant is also great. Definitely a great place to go to for special occasion or simply for quality time with good friends :-)

photos.caption: Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Oysters
Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Steak and egg

8FODvlKHD0X-Ca2NVXSV_A.text: One of the best places downtown. A must try if you're spending time in PITT.

W1lO2x88VSd3aMP2XFZUbA.text: 3 of us enjoyed a cozy, warm, attractive booth for dinner on a Saturday.  Lighting is subdued. This place just says: "Worth it for whatever you spend!"  Service was by pros, not your run of the mill wait staff.  The beef tenderloin was excellent, the chicken was tender: everything reeked of quality.  You cannot go wrong here.  Desserts knocked it out of the PNC Park!  We cannot wait to go back in the Spring to visit our Pitt kid.  This will be first choice for dinner. Gorgeous restaurant.

W_XvEdD8Fw3YfioHX6iGPw.text: Amazing food and exceptional service! Have been here a few times for corporate events with a fairly large group and don't have one complaint! Laura is an amazing waitress and has been more than accommodating. Julie, the chef has gone out of her way to provide a special request dessert more than once with very little notice for us! Great service & people. Can't wait to go back.

A2w3_IrsPm7_k9BGSW-n6A.text: Not worth the price.  For quality of food that is probably about 10% better, they charge 3X the price.  If I check my mathematics, that doesn't add up.

GxBbGcXr5o6EAO0i9kRePw.text: This restaurant is probably the pride of the Pittsburgh natives.  From the surface, they have it all.  Cool vibe, dim lighting, open kitchen, sleek decor, specialty chef, etc.  It is definitely a more formal place and I would consider it "Fine Dining" so that is important you know that before you go.  It is the kind of place that doesn't have specials because the chef is constantly changing the menu to fit what is in season.  It is also the kind of place where a bread boy walks around with a basket of goodies and rations them out to each patron.  That's all fine and dandy but to some extent I just wanted him to leave the basket of bread and take a hike.  Moving on...Our server was annoying.  She was stalking our table and she didn't come across as sincere.  Hard to explain but she wouldn't just allow us to enjoy ourselves.  We had a 6pm reservation.  I mean it isn't like she was trying to turn our table....I think she was just bored.  When my husband made the reservation they asked him if it was a special occasion and he told them, yes...our 8th year anniversary.  Just a note to management...don't ask if you don't plan on acknowledging it.  We have been asked in the past but then brought out a little box of chocolates, given free desert, etc.  But here?  Nope.  We got hassled by the waitress.  I ordered the pike which was pretty good.  It was served with brussel sprouts and sauteed apples and all types of other colorful things around the perimeter of the plate.  It was good, not great.  Hubby ordered the salmon which is served just pan seared but raw on the inside.  He requested that it be cooked through to medium well.  Well, guess what?  It was pinker than a newborn baby.  He didn't enjoy it at all.  He told the waitress and she quickly offered to have it cooked through so we waited and it came back in crumbled pieces of cooked salmon.  It tasted much better but again, no apology from management.  That is just my pet peeve I guess.  We passed on dessert because none of them stood out to us.  We grabbed the check and left.   There are some good things about this place but they could use some fine tuning.

9NY03bVmagITP3hY7xENxg.text: not impressed in relation to what i've been told, expensive for the quality of food

ioL3zzPgx0OwY3--20FOrA.text: The food here is delicious and upscale. You will need a reservation--it can be a challenge to get in at a normal dinner time without booking in advance. Also, it's pricey but worth it. We went for our anniversary.   The interior is cool... like a loft with urban touches. We had a table upstairs. It was right along the rail and felt very intimate and romantic.  Great tuna tartare to begin. My swordfish was delicious, and my husband's meat was expertly cooked. Excellent pairings.  The desserts are incredible! The Chocolate-Peanut-Pretzel Candy Bar is ridiculous good.  Expert service, a great fine dining experience.  Can't wait to try brunch!

UzwvgkqVaD-NTLCr9QpVXg.text: I like to eat at nearly any time of day, but brunch holds a special spot in my heart. Since I'd heard so much praise about Eleven, I decided to entrust it with my Sunday brunch experience. It didn't disappoint.  The prix-fixe brunch special that a lot of Big Burrito places seem to have--one appetizer, one entree, and one juice or cocktail for $25--is a great deal. For my appetizer, I had the goat cheese doughnuts. That sounds bizarre, I know, but the goat cheese is subtle, and gives the lil' rings a nice tanginess. I also tried my brother's appetizer of choice, the grilled sticky, which was like a hybrid of a cinnamon roll and French toast in caramel sauce. The bread basket Eleven served was also yummy, with biscuits, mini-muffins, and a croissant, plus house-made vanilla butter and raspberry preserves. I had the Ruby Red Greyhound as my cocktail, which was gin and grapefruit juice, and it was delicious.   That was a lot of carbs and sugar, so I sadly abstained from the vanilla bean waffle. The mushroom and red pepper omelet, however, was a fair enough consolation. We had absolutely no room for dessert.  The service was great, and the atmosphere of the place was really pleasant. Thanks, Big Burrito, for being so consistent with good service and food at your multiple restaurants.

lcqmHb0gFOUZ80R5MNz4Gg.text: Going to a restaurant with my parents is always such a hassle. They complain about food, ambience, price, and whatever else they can. Eleven was one of the only places that didn't incite a storm of complaints.   We went for brunch and got the brunch prie-fixe options, each of us choosing a drink, appetizer, and entree.  From the fresh squeezed orange juice to the perfectly medium rare steak, the whole meal experience was amazing. They provided complimentary croissants and muffins, made fresh daily (which were amazing as well).  In terms of appetizers, I'd recommend the seafood or the hash. The salad is slightly unorthodox (for us anyway).  I think any of the entree options are great, though the steak and eggs came with a deep-fried poached egg, which was as amazing as it sounds.  The server was polite, the ambience was fancy, and the timing of each course was perfect - the entree was up in a timely manner after we all finished our appetizers (and every dish came out exactly at the same time).  So overall, A+ for everything. It wasn't even the most expensive brunch place you could go to, but it's one of the best places you could go.

QSh12qavT1zK93wiqvKuNA.text: I went to Eleven on a Tuesday night, and if you know Pittsburgh, you know that the downtown pretty much shuts down after 7pm. Regardless, there have been a bunch of conventions and shows in and out of town, so I made a reservation. It is recommended, but you could probably get away without, since they also have an upstairs floor.  For food, I started with the three sisters salad. The salad was a bigger portion that I expected, and it had just the right amount of dressing (and I don't usually like dressing on my salads). As my entree, I ordered the seafood combo. Oh man, was it delicious. It came with two perfectly cooked scallops, a round and fat crab cake patty, and a piece of salmon. I love seafood, so this dish was perfect for me. All of that was served on a bed of risotto that complimented the food very well. Last but not least, DESSERT! Even though I was stuffed, dessert deserves a separate stomach, so we ordered the candy bar and the orange (i think?) pudding cake. Both were delicious and highly recommended by our waitress.  Overall, the service was great. Our waitress was knowledgeable about the menu items, and I trusted her recommendations. The food was delicious, and the ambiance was nice. The food/drink is a little more pricey than what I would usually pay, but I would go again for a special occasion.

Zr2dzNUdKmZpGtC5S_7npQ.text: Great restaurant; excellent service.  Interesting menu.  Went for a date night before the Pen's game.  Fantastic farm to table choices. The orecchiette with chicken of the woods mushrooms was earthy  and delicate at the same time.  Service was attentive.  As an interesting aside, it smelled AMAZING; like something delicious roasting.  Husband had the hangar steak; it was done perfectly.  Will definitely be going here again.

jobNr9XWg4obCBgDHNKyjw.text: Great atmosphere, superb drinks and menu. Only been here for brunch but found it to be excellent.

bF4LdEFm0PR_EygPO8gy2g.text: I came to Eleven for brunch today after it was recommended by both a co worker who lives in the area and a friend who is frequently in Pittsburgh for work.  I arrived around noon on Sunday and chose to sit in the lounge area as I was dining solo while out of town for work.  They have a great brunch deal - any appetizer, main course and cocktail from their menu all for $25.  This also came with a complimentary bread basket which was a nice touch.  I decided on the bloody mary for my drink - now, I am normally a fan of some spice in my bloody mary's, but this was too much for even me!  I really enjoyed the muffin in the bread basket, and decided on the beignets for my app and eggs benedict for my main.  The beignets were very fresh and hot and the eggs benny was pretty good - I have had better and I found the ham/bacon on the bottom to be a little salty and was a little strong tasting.  This restaurant has great atmosphere and service though.  If I am in Pittsburgh again I will definitely put it on my list for a dinner place.  Also, I think that it is normally pretty pricey for dinner, so I really recommend it to anyone as an upscale brunch spot but without the price tag.

i3SV2PU8QCva-1bXezi4AQ.text: I can't believe I haven't reviewed this place yet. The first few months after I moved up here, my boyfriend and I were regulars in their bar. Once a week we would hit the bar, try out a few drinks, and order a crap ton of appetizers.  Before I discovered Meat & Potatoes wonderfulness, Eleven was my favorite restaurant in Pittsburgh. Their bartenders are awesome and the food is just to die for. It is so. damn. good. Based on last summer season's menu, we had tried every appetizer they have and a few entrees. I am just a big fan of samples lol so I love ordering a bunch of different apps.   Out of all of Big Burrito's restaurants I think Eleven is the best (though I have not eaten at Umi - yet). They make the best cucumber martini my boyfriend said he's ever had. And their Leven-ade is super delicious. For food, you HAVE to try the roasted chicken entree if you have not yet. It makes me want to hug my own face, it's so good. The skin is crispy, the meat is juicy and tender, and the risotto once was really good. The other time it was crunchy.  When it's a nice day and they have the big windows open - omg, do I love it. We used to hang out there for hours. We haven't been back recently, but something tells me the food is still spot on.

JyJey9mNefdMSTjld-3mQA.text: Have been here several times and have nothing negative to say. From the pre-dinner cocktails to the cheese plate with port for dessert, the Eleven experience is certainly one that you can make memorable. I know a lot of people complain about the prices, but this is fine dining. Not Primanti's. You are coming here, one hopes, to enjoy the best quality food and beverage the area has to offer. And for the unrefined palate, some of the dishes may seem off putting. Foie gras scares a lot of people when the find out what it is. What they need to learn is that it's delicious!  Especially if you happen to be there when the chef has prepared it torchon.  If you have money to spend, order what you like and ask the sommelier to pair the wines for you as you go. Yes, it's pricey, and the wine is served in a full portion, not tasting portions. So maybe Uber into town if you are going to do that. If not, just try the suggested chef's tasting menu with pairings. It is a great deal for what you get.     The service here is wonderful. I've never had an ill interaction with the staff here. They are attentive, knowledgeable, friendly, and respectful from the time you enter the door to the time you leave.   We have been here for several special occasions and plan to keep coming back for more!

QVBCX5JlIBo7Tgb9PEuxZA.text: I brought my boyfriend here for his birthday. I reserved the Chef's Table, which means the chef prepared a 9-course meal customized for us based on our like/dislikes, and we sat next to the kitchen so that he could present each of the dishes to us. We also had each dish paired with wine.  I did not give them a whole lot to work with during the interview. I told them that we eat a lot of seafood, but also enjoy vegetarian dishes as well as red meat dishes (so essentially I was saying we eat everything). I said that I strongly dislike bananas (which might sound weird, but I really cannot stand the taste/smell/texture of them).  I also said that we are willing to try anything once, and the chef should just have some fun and bring out some of his favorite dishes. I have always been impressed with the food here, but this time in particular I was blown away.  We started by taking advantage of their gin selection and ordered some gin and tonics. We later realized this was unnecessary and that there would be more than enough wine to go around, but we didn't realize how generously poured their pairings would be.  The nine courses included oysters, scallops, halibut, oxtail, fois gras, lamb, and 2 desserts. Each of the dishes came with some unique toppings that were combined to create some sensation flavor pairings. For example, the scallops (my favorite dish) were served with heirloom tomatoes, lardo (cured strips of pork fat), and tarragon, all over smoked corn grits. The foie gras (my boyfriend's favorite) was served over zucchini bread with fig, blackberry, and red wine vinegar. I could have never dreamed up these combinations, but I am so glad that our chef could!  The meal was not cheap, but it was well-worth the price and was a great way to celebrate the special occasion.

wAk05Q0COa5pw95RQrEMqw.text: I went in to this place with good expectations, let me just say-- they were met and surpassed.   Service: 5 stars - Edward was awesome!  Food: 5 stars   My boyfriend and I started out with the Grilled Peaches and the Yellow tail Sashimi. The Grilled Peaches were heaven. The combination of the goat cheese, peaches, Serrano ham and a balsamic reduction: Wow!   For our entrees - I ordered the Halibut. It was cocked perfectly and the cream corn complimented it wonderfully. My boyfriend got the lamb. It was just like lamb should be - rare to medium rare and tender.   For desert we had the Peach Marscapone Cannoli. I have to say this is probably one of the best cannoli's I have ever had.   This restaurant really highlighted the fruit that was in season and did a wonderful job. A highly satisfying meal.   Our wine: A Petit Verdot (and if you have never had this type of wine before - you should try it..

HiKryZaezZiU2_5Jq1-yMg.text: BRUNCH!  It really is the most important meal of the week, ESPECIALLY after a late night booze-laced wedding reception the night before.  I really think we found the best (and maybe ONLY) classy brunch place in the city.  (we are from Philly...).  What a very cool space!  The ambiance was airy, open, and yet every table had a private feeling.  Our server was excellent, and I couldn't believe what a great value!  In Philly or DC or NYC this brunch would have been well over $300.  They have this Prix Fixe brunch menu for $25 where you get a brunch cocktail, an appetizer, and an entree.  Yes Please!  I had the spicy bloody mary with pickled veggies, nice and spicy, and I LOVED that there was a pickled carrot in my glass!  Cool!  The mimosas were also delicious.  My appetizer was the oysters, nice and fresh, with a unique Eleven recipe hot sauce to accompany them, habanero/mango sauce.  I was surprised how well it complimented the oysters, which were fresh and delicious.    My entree was the Eggs Benedict with a truffled hollandaise sauce.  I think they made the english muffins in house, they were AMAZING...and they used two whole muffins! It was served with a citrus salad, fresh oranges and grapefruit with mint, it was SO refreshing and a perfect way to cleanse the palate after brunch.  And finally, the grilled sticky.  This amazing dish requires its own review really... HUGE slices of brioche, like over two inches thick, grilled and glazed with a bacon butterscotch drizzle over the top. WOWOWOWOWOWOWOW.  We ordered two for the table, on top of everything else, because that's how good it was. WOW.    I don't know when I"ll be back in Pittsburgh, but I'd love to try out the dinner menu here!

Z-Z9xYNVpiVA8uKX2e5eEw.text: I die.   best tuna tartare I've had ever. truffle sauce, white anchovy and black caviar.  some little bread lady with a basket comes by and drops off goodies at your table - I fancied the sea salted focaccia in particular   braised beef goodness mashed potato life  veggies galore  truffle sauceylove I mean, the list goes on.  the salmon seared whatever else is ..  ok just go. go now. GO GO Go.

RswkPtrcaeYxR8g507P_ZQ.text: Our dinner last night was outstanding!  From the fantastic celery leaf gimlets, grilled Hamachi collar, and tuna tartar we had at the bar - to the wonderful tasting menu we had in the beautiful dining room - everything was truly spot on!  Our waiter was Brian - what a gem.  Chef Stevens is a genius - that dinner was amazing.  Amanda, the manager came over to check on us as well.  It's one of our favorite places!

uKMNHOnQ3jsj8suV9eXAmQ.text: I have never been so angry after eating at a restaurant. This is my first yelp review since 2009 but I had to start with this place, our experience was just awful.   We arrived at 8:45 WITH a reservation. The place was half empty yet we were sat in a back room on the second floor with two other couples. There was no music and the tvs were off so it was fairly awkward. The rest of the restaurant looked trendy, but this room seemed like just a place to have staff meetings. We asked to be moved to one of the five open two-tops we could see in the main room below but we were told that they were already reserved. Only one had been filled by the time we left at 10:00.    The server was completely clueless about anything on the menu which is surprising for a place this expensive ($200 for two people). He was unable to answer basic questions about the food and drink menu. The service in general was terrible, when we left the hostesses just started at us and didn't say a word, and the two valet guys did the same as they watched us try to hail a cab.   The food was mediocre at best. I ordered the lamb loin chop which was ok but very small, definitely not worth $38. My girlfriend got the prime strip steak which was not good. The menu said that it came with pickled peppers, but a $45 steak that tastes completely like pickles? Are you serious? Also, it came pre-sliced which was a bit of a surprise as well.   The waiter recommended the tasting menu yet when we ordered the first course a la carte he informed us they were all out. Why would he even suggest something if it wasn't even available? We got the oysters instead which were great, but they were raw; thats more of a testament to the quality of the oysters than to the chef.  Overall the food was terrible and the service was even worse. I would recommend avoiding this place at all costs. $200 down the drain. Definitely will never come back here.

ByrpuVWWzdW5ngHU6sco9Q.text: YES YES YES! Wow. Brunch is amazing. Didn't realize how beautiful this place is. Very deceiving from penn ave. everything was amazing. Our waiter Derek was the best. He let us know what as going on and didnt mind we rode our bikes there and was wearing less then business casual. Probably will be back at least twice a month for brunch til I die.

ngjDYW_Xb38zj0qBuxZ9bg.text: Best happy hour in town! Awesome drinks and food. 4 stars because I would only eat here at happy hour prices. I don't mind spending extra on. high-quality food, but the dinner food is too expensive for what you get.

sT4jOXe41qGmH5dASinU0A.text: Any bar or restaurant can have good food or drinks. Any happy hour can have great prices. However, it is so few and far between that you find a bartender that is as knowledgable, friendly, and professional as Josh at Eleven! This restaurant is fortunate to have a bartender as kind and as hospitable as him. Both his food and drink recommendations were fantastic. All of the drinks were unique and refreshing and the oysters were extremely flavorful. However, like I said, good food and drinks can be found anywhere. It is the service that keeps guests coming in the door and Josh is the best in the business! I will most certainly be spreading the word!

frQgpvKrLfKdwDRSe0WcKA.text: This is a stellar place for happy hour - their Eleven Mules is one of the best cocktails I've ever had.  Unfortunately, their dinner isn't as great.  I was intrigued by their vegetarian tasting menu, but it fell flat, along with their regular tasting menu and a la carte dishes.  I came here with my husband and two other Pittsburgh family members that we see a few times a year.  The tasting menus (vegetarian and regular) were blah.  Good but not great, and definitely not worth the price.  The a la carte choices were more well received, but probably because they were less expensive.  When our check came, we were definitely not impressed.  We could have had a much better meal for our money.  BIg Burrito - this is an embarrassment for you!

lNOw0yF5a3JVSEnJSIM1kA.text: My Wife and dined at Eleven for my birthday in 2013.  We started out with glasses of Champagne, which was authentic and delicious.  We then decided to do the chef's tasting menu.  They had a scallop salad, lamb, fish and dessert.  All were very tasty.   Overall, this is a fun restaurant.  Very upscale, very tasty.  The prices are high, so expect to go there and spend $200 on dinner.  We were not blown away with the food, but it was very good and enjoyable.

FisxzSgKBlZdRrpfm76JJw.text: Very cold beer glasses, but the rest was meh. Limp and forgettable oysters, lack of bar ambiance and attention, bleh.  Had a drink and left.

0-joh9S6QowDWWmREjh22g.text: I went here for a romantic date with my boyfriend. The food was fabulous, but our service was not good (hence the 4 stars).   We ordered the crab cake appetizer (I highly recommend!), lots of crab meat. I ordered the beef tenderloin, and he got the prime strip steak. My meal was fabulous, meat cooked perfectly. However, my boyfriends steak was cooked rare when he had asked for it medium. He couldn't even eat the middle of the steak it was so rare (I don't mind rare, but when you order it one way it should come that way). Besides that the food was top notch. For dessert he got creme brulee, and I got the peach crostata (both were very very good!).   As for the service, we sat with empty glasses for at least 20 minutes, and bread was never offered to us. We also sat with finished plates for a long time waiting to hear about dessert. It was not even that busy at the time we were there, so not sure about that.  The food is so good I will certainly be back, but the service should be stepped up.

t1kEpb6yk0gZAxgoOmrZXQ.text: Let me start off by saying that Eleven is one of my favorites restaurants in Pittsburgh. It is one of my favorite Big Burrito restaurants as well, along with Umi and Casbah. I love the urban, upscale feel of the restaurant. It isn't pretentious, and everything from the decor to the flatware is tasteful and elegant. My husband and I most recently came here to celebrate our anniversary, and we weren't disappointed.  I started with a glass a of the pinot blanc/pinot gris blend from Alsace (one of my favorite regions for white wines in the entire universe), and it was delicious. They had a good wine list, which is one of my favorite things about Eleven.  I started with the tuna tartare, which was delicious. It kept with tradition, while still being inventive and fresh. I loved the caviar on top! I had the seafood tasting this time around because I was feeling indecisive, and it was lovely to be able to try a little bit of several things. The portion size was perfectly adequate for me, but then, I don't like feeling overly stuffed when I leave a restaurant. The salmon was cooked well (there is nothing worse than overcooked salmon), and the scallop and crabcake were delicious. My husband had the pork chop, and the glazed beets in the dish were outstanding.  Next time, I look forward to exploring some of Eleven's cocktails options as well as more of the menu items.

YzpBH5-PeVMDbujz4oP89g.text: Nasty, nasty woman behind the bar. Her attitude (which was both vocal and physical) cost her teammates $$$$$. Just goes to show you, on or off the field - a bad teammate, is a bad teammate.

l1cgo2OqIHA8blpZ5IUEsA.text: Cool, contemporary American food in nice atmosphere with excellent service. The brunch at $29 is an incredible value. Plenty of parking across the street and only $5 valet. In the summer the second floor terrace is open as well as the garage styled doors in the lower level.

photos.caption: Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Very good food, cool atmosphere and excellent service. We went for brunch and had different dishes that were all fresh.

42EoBJ6M5h-kauZ1Z5MJBA.text: We went twice for the Sunday Brunch, once for our wedding anniversary and the other time for Easter. Brunch is fabulous, the prix fixe menu includes a cocktail, appetizer and entree for $29, a great price for a fabulous meal.  The decor is outstanding, I want to go back with a group of friends for one of the private dining rooms. Service is impeccable. Love, love, love this place.

0LnNU011IBXCGNo9RZJ4CQ.text: Most reviewers here have an inflated opinion of this restaurant IMHO. I'm a foodie and I've lived in NYC, Philly and LA. My take on Eleven is that they did an OK job at pretty much everything. I do not think this is a great restaurant or even comes close to rivaling some of the nicer restaurants in Philadelphia, NY, LA, Chicago, etc.   I ordered their tasting menu because I wanted to get a feel for the place rather than pick what I thought I would like.  I should say that I did not have anything bad; I just did not think this was anything to write home about.

QNb60HPXfyOOrz_qE9Dkjw.text: Ho-lee SCHNIEKIES.  I went to Eleven on a Saturday night during a weekend visit to Pittsburgh. I'd read the menu and it sounded terrific, so I decided to give it a shot. AND I took my 11 & 9 year-old kids with me (they're adventurous sorts, they are).  Often, I can tell how a dining experience is going to go based on how my kids are greeted. I take them to a lot of "foodie" places and if they're welcomed with smiles, which they certainly were at Eleven, that's usually a good sign.  We were seated upstairs, near the bar, at a relaxed table with soft lighting. Terrific atmosphere, very nice, but casual--there was no air of pretense here at all, though again, everything was very nice.  We started with drinks, and I had the restaurant's signature Moscow Mule. They make it with house-made ginger beer that REALLY has a great bite (I'm super-picky about such things and hate it when ginger beer is too sweet) and cucumber vodka. The pairing was PERFECT. A lovely cocktail ... we were off to the races.  Then, friends, there was the food. I started with roasted pumpkin & potato soup that was crowned with homemade pumpkin seed granola. On an evening when the weather was raw, biting, and damp, this was more than welcome. Warm, creamy, and just a bit spicy, it was the perfect beginning to the meal.  Dinner was magnificent. My son had the roasted chicken, which was moist & tender (he said it was one of the best things he'd ever eaten and told me that it was so good, his head might well explode--this is a compliment of the highest order when you're 11). His meal was complemented by risotto, wilted Swiss chard, and all was served in a shallow pool of thyme jus.  My daughter, not to be outdone, got the Walleye Pike, which was pan-seared (absolutely tender and perfectly cooked) and served on wild rice, with dried cranberries, pecans, pea tendrils, and toasted chili puree, with cider saffron beurre blanc (and yeah, she ate the WHOLE thing). It was wonderful.  I had the beet salad, which was lovely with goat cheese vinaigrette and baby kale, but the coup de grace were the sea scallops, which are easily among the better things I've ever eaten. Two monster-sized sea scallops were wrapped in potato (I have no idea what evil genius thought this up, but DUDE) and served in a delicious bed of tasso ham, Sea Island red peas, and smoked onions. Holy CATS. So good.  I'm a fan of Big Burrito's restaurants, in general, but MAN! This was an experience I'll not soon forget. I might even drive up to Pittsburgh again soon just to have dinner here.  Just extraordinary. Oh! And the service was top-notch, too.

6jpU1K2PN5goaxqox2UbNQ.text: *Sunday brunch review*  The $25 price fixe brunch is a great deal!  For the price, you get a cocktail, an appetizer, and a main course.  I had a mimosa which was just perfect, the right ratio of OJ to champagne.  For my appetizer, I got the Three Greens salad (because I figured I should eat some veggies before gourging on what was to come...), which actually was wonderful.  I could have eaten just that and been satisfied for a normal lunch.  They also brought us a complimentary bread basket full of mini goodies like biscuits, muffins and croissants.  I had a mini biscuit with honey butter and it was delicious.  I wish it had been warm, but otherwise it was a perfect texture.  For my main course I had the shrimp and scallion omelet which came with bacon (they make it themselves! awesome) and potatoes.  The BACON....O.M.G.  It had a pepper rub on the edges and it was very meaty.  It could have been a tad crispier but I think that's because it was so thick.  It was so good and the dish came with THREE pieces which I ate all of (snort, snort...I'm a little piggie!).  The omelet itself was wonderful as well, but I could have eaten just bacon and the delicious side of potatoes and been happy.  The service was really good, too.  I was impressed.  Although I would note that there's no reason to take away perfectly unused silverware between courses...I support being green and not re-washing clean silverware for no reason.  Anyway, this was by far the best food I had in Pittsburgh.  I am glad we didn't go for dinner because of the recent "meh" reviews and considering the price, I would have been sad if it wasn't amazing.  But for brunch...it's a great deal and some awesome food.  Very impressed!!

Px5OdpwcyLD1qAePNXZH7Q.text: I stopped in here for lunch today. I decided to go with a medium burger and fries. Look at the plate. I added cheddar cheese, they have those cool straw onions and a pickle. It was delish! Well made, great service by a beautiful bartender.  Let me point out the lunch was perfect for a one hour lunch break. Plus this place is just so clean and just a neat setup. Yes it's a tad expensive. I think it's worth the stop. ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sea Scallops. ;)
Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Yellowtail shishima? Guessing at the spelling ;)
Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

cHHwwiTQvhU3ycP9BS-5SQ.text: Visiting Pittsburgh for the first time, I am delighted this was my first meal in the city. Everything brought to the table, from the celery-infused gimlet to the bread, appetizers, the entrees and desserts, everything was fresh, inventive, and beautifully considered. Kudos to the chef.

r8Qit1zsbC1J3w69QuFGAQ.text: Great atmosphere with the windows open.  Food was great - had the steak and fries.  Would highly recommend!

KDIDr-m7VQkG6YzwOqFrvg.text: Dinner was excellent. The filet was amazing, garnished with Gorgonzola cream sauce. The seafood sampler was also delicious, as was the foie gras. Ask for the table upstairs overlooking the bar with curtains for privacy. It is a great place to celebrate a special occasion.

UtPKMNm_2jykWSj_a7WeiA.text: Great atmosphere with an eclectic menu that is always changing.  Only down is how crowded it is and difficultly getting a table. The bar is very crowded so don't expect to get  a seat unless you get there early and stay a long time. But the drinks and bartenders are great!

jZ6s-2tDxxWQ3L_WYoqJEg.text: Went to Eleven for dinner Friday night. The staff were all very kind and accommodating, from the valet to our waiter. My date and I shared the ricotta cavatelli and tuna tartar to start, both were delicious and exceeded our expectations. A member of the front of the house brought a basket of bread to choose from, it was difficult to only chose one. For dinner my date had the halibut with polenta, the consistency of the polenta was next to divine, I could have made a meal of that alone. The texture and flavors and the way they intertwined has made me crave it ever since. Dessert was amazing as well, sorbet and creme brulee. Only 4 stars as I had to send back my martini 2xs as it wasn't made properly. The first one was delicious but the following one tasted of hair spray. All in all an amazing atmosphere and impeccable dishes.

3ruZCH0H5YXaK3l0KQ-ZuA.text: Mmm was that good! My boyfriend and I just finished up my birthday dinner at Eleven-What a wonderful experience! We had dinner reservations for 7 but arrived a half n hr early and were seated right away. Our watress was very polite and knowledgeable. We started off with some cocktails. I had Eleven Mules and it might have been the most refreshing, delicious mule I've had. For our entrees, My boyfriend had the eleysian farm lamb cooked med-rare..AMAZING. I had the seafood tasting with my salmon cooked med-rare and it was perfect. The scallops were so good that I wished it came with more than 1. But the meal itself was the perfect size portion. For dessert we decided to go with the white chocolate panna cotte which was recommended by our watress. We were not disappointed!  :) Can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

aj4Px3PHJnTf06StDpJEQQ.text: Overpriced and slow.  If you order the seafood tasting, they will ask you if you want one of them to come out first. This is a trick. They charged me for a crab cake appetizer, instead of just bringing the crab cake out that comes with the entree.

WJaVO6-bpycaf9fTsp9vCw.text: LUNCH REVIEW:  My first visit to Eleven was for lunch and I am eager to try dinner there.  The food was creative and perfectly cooked.  I found a few of the dishes slightly salty for my palate.  We had the roasted chicken and the scallops.  They were perfectly cooked and paired well with the white wine we had.    The service was the kicker here though.  Despite excellent food we found the service quite slow, particularly for a lunch spot.  It took 15 min before we could order and another 15 minutes after we were done before we could ask for our check.  We only had an hour for lunch and had hoped to have dessert as well.  Our food was brought rather promptly after we ordered, and I believe took less time than getting a waiter to take our order :)    Give yourself time if you go here for lunch.

5cGGhXSZwadp-_CVfdQpaw.text: I have eaten here 2 times in the last month, and have had spectacular service and food.  Lots of great fish selections.  Incredible wine selection.  My most recent visit, I have a Chef's food & wine pairing consisting of a starter Tuna tartare topped with white anchovy and caviar paired with Champagne, then moved to a green and white asparagus salad with miners lettuce, Surryano ham paired with an Italian Marchesa Gavi Liguria, then the main course consisting of a lamb chop with cous cous with a great blend of spices paired with a Napa Steltzer Estate Cab.  Simply amazing pairings...

photos.caption: Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

2IkPLWu--EiiofJ5UZw6qg.text: We were at a birthday party.  The cheese antipasto platter was plentiful.  The bread was amazing.  The appetizer was Melba toast with cheese and a pierogie - very good.   The spring salad - I could've eaten as a meal.  At my table we had chicken with risotto, hangar steak with asparagus, and salmon with fresh vegetables.   All were large portions and enjoyable. Dessert was a trio of sweets: chocolate peanut butter graham cracker, bananas over a cookie, and pound cake - at that point we went from satiated to uncomfortably full.  We were eating on the outside balcony.  The view was beautiful.  As the sun set, the manager was very prompt to lower the blinds to shade us.  The wait staff tried hard to meet the requests of the guests. Another waiter would have expedited beverage requests.  Utilize valet parking ($6) rather than dealing with the parking lot across the street ($5).  $10 for a mediocre mojito ... $8 for a beer ... ugh

FHP-tMJ9YNQbEguGne7SSg.text: Amazing food & service! My husband and I stopped here to celebrate our 5th wedding anniversary. I ordered the ricotta cavatelli for my entree and my husband got the hanger steak. We also split a three greens salad. (We didn't want to fill up too much before our main course.) The cavatelli was the ultimate comfort food. There was something familiar in the tase, but also original in flavor. It was the perfect combination of nostalgia and inventiveness. (This meal is vegetarian fyi.) I sampled my husband's steak and it was amazing. Best steak I ever sampled! For dessert, we ordered the "candy bar", a delicious chocolate cake with a peanut butter frosting, served with chocolate ice cream. They personalized it, with "Happy Anniversary" written with chocolate icing on a piece of white chocolate. The food was awesome and the service was equally outstanding. We will definitely be coming back!

WYy9JA9g7mBSeZpZs9dnaQ.text: If I had an option I'd put the review at 3.5 star. The atmosphere and seating arrangements are fantastic. Staff was friendly. The food isn't as good as I'd hoped it would be. The Salmon and the Hanger steak were just "OK". Especially when you're paying this kind of money. The desserts were delicious though. Loved both the Candy Bar and the Warm Dark Chocolate Cake.  Probably won't be coming back here myself unless I can't find anything better in Pittsburgh for special occasions.

YTzw1ncnrHAOOqHS2haJsA.text: We came here for brunch on a Sunday morning and really enjoyed the meal minus the hostess' attitude and seating arrangement. Prior to coming we checked open table to see if we should make a reservation. There were all times available so I didn't think it should be an issue. When we arrived the hostess would not seat us at an actual table and said there was "plenty of self seating in the bar". There wasn't. We had to squeeze in at the bar and it was less than ideal. I don't understand why she wouldn't seat us when there were plenty of available reservations like I said and looking at the actual dining room plenty of open tables. Anyway, the food itself was really great. We had the steak and eggs and the breakfast sandwich. I might be back provided I can actually be seated next time.

iduSDHWwnOMAHfCJLrqplA.text: Nice restaurant with nice presentationOr food and drinks, great service. I tried thei steak and it is unbelievable. It was a big portion too. My friend had a vegetarian dish and  it was great. The drinks were outstanding. We had made reservations but was a weekday and we sat Upstairs. There was plenty of room.I will return and most likely visit the other restaurants that are owned by the same businessman.

photos.caption: Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

4yvwM9M686ySc5nFRY6xsg.text: At a convention and stopped in for a quick lunch. What a great surprise. Ate a crab cake sandwich at the bar. All of the baked goods are made on site adding a special freshness. Bar staff was friendly, but not too chatty - exactly what I like as a middle-aged woman who often travels alone. Far above standard lunch fare and service.

aIDjRiPE76SrXHECArF7ag.text: Ok. 2nd visit but 1st visit drinks only. So let me comment on bar. Good. Very good. Staff friendly, attentive but not overly so. Also very helpful.to newbies not familiar with specials etc. 2nd visit happy hour...$7 grey.goose martinis! WHAT?! Mmmhmmm. Happy.hour bar food tasty and decently priced. Not large quantities so plan accordingly. Crowd upscale and millennial. Well dressed and business. If I lived here might be a regular. Go. Drink. Eat.. Sit at the bar. Nice vibe.

Z0Z5vngrNg6ff40pYRq3yg.text: All-around great restaurant!  My wife and I were in town for a weekend from DC so we came for brunch on Sunday.  We utilized their valet parking service for $6 because alternative parking was $12 due to an event at the convention center.  The valet attendant and hostess were both inviting and we were seated at a large booth that was among other diners, but also allowed us to have a private conversation.  The server was attentive and genuinely wanted us to have a good experience.  They had a prix fixe brunch menu that included a starter, entree, and brunch cocktail for $29.  It seemed like a good deal on the surface, and based on the quality and portion size it was well worth it!  We shared one prix fixe meal and ordered an ala carte starter to share.  We had a moscow mule that was tart and delicious.  For starters, we had the avocado toast and short rib hash, both were excellent.  The actual toast for the avocado toast was a dense bread that may have been a bit too dense, but the overall dish was still very good.  We shared the Eleven burger for the entree and it was one of the best burgers I've ever had.  The veal pattie was tender and juicy and the bacon was perfectly cooked.  One detail that I liked was that they served the pickle spear on a piece of lettuce so the juice didn't spread across the plate and make the bottom of the bun soggy!  Another testament to their hospitality was when we asked the food runner for a second plate so we could share the burger, she offered to take it back to the kitchen and cut it for us.  It was nice that I didn't have to deal with butchering the burger in an attempt to cut it in half; they simply whisked it away and it came back on two plates with half a burger and half the fries on each plate.  The service, food, and ambiance were all outstanding at this restaurant and I strongly recommend dining here!

JD0zAVFhcR8cj0Xk5dNfRw.text: Delicious food!  Perfect service and great atmosphere. They even repaired the zipper on my husbands coat while we ate. We didn't ask, they just noticed that his zipper was stuck and fixed it. I haven't had service like that in a very long time.

12qaHclfCIEQyYObyuUkGQ.text: My husband I and I went here for our one year wedding anniversary this past Saturday. This was my first time at Eleven and I think it will not be my last!  We started out with an appetizer of spicy tuna tartare with drinks from their specialty cocktail menu. My husband had their manhattan and I had their Moscow Mule which i switched out the vodka for hendricks gin with no problem. Both drinks and the appetizer were delicious. We also experienced the bread person that comes around and the sea salt focaccia  is worth every single carb/calorie.  Our waiter, Brian I think was his name, did an excellent job spacing out our courses to finish our drinks and app/bread before our entrees were served. I had the Elysian Fields Farm Lamb Loin with mushrooms, asparagus, and tons of flavor. So delicious and melted in my mouth!!! My husband went for the seafood tasting. The crab cake was the largest I've seen with large chunks of crab, the scallop was perfectly medium rare and melted in your mouth like butter, there was also halibut and grits that were also excellent. We each had a house wine, chosen by our waiter,  that paired with our meal these were roughly $10-13/glass and both delicious! For dessert we each had creme brulee that came with fresh rasberries, a french macaroon, and a little chocolate badge with 'Happy Anniversary' on it. We each had a glass of champagne for toasting. :)   All in all an excellent experience. The inside of the restaurant is beautiful. I was told by a friend when I asked about dress code was that I would find people in jeans with heels all the way up to floor length gowns. This was actually very True as i saw both and everything in between.  We will definitely be back in the future!

ajdBGfxXb6pyJ3xItF_JlQ.text: I'm a fan of this place. Decor is beautiful, with a cool industrial/suave (totally invented that term) vibe and warm lighting. Dishes are hearty and diverse. I attended with a party of 3, and our table was a little to big for us. If your party is between 2 and 5 people, prepare for an awkward seating arrangement. Furthermore, our waiter and busboy were both a little awkward,  and uninformed on some features of the menu. Not a huge issue, everyone at my table found their farces pretty funny anyway. These two are my only "negative criticisms" of the experience, if that.  We started with the crab cake and the sheep's milk gnudi. The crab cake was delectable, and far more crab than cake, which speaks to the high quality of the establishment. I usually don't like sheep's milk, but the gnudi was not too sour for me, and it's balsamic sauce complimented it very well. I had the Gerber Farms Chicken, which was absolutely delicious. The white meat of the chicken wholesome and juicy, and the meat from its leg was mixed into the risotto, the swiss chard functioned as a perfect counter to the heavy starch and protein. The bird was locally sourced from a farm in Ohio. Fresh is best! My girlfriend ordered the Red Snapper, and her mom ordered Swordfish. both tasty.  If you like chocolate, ORDER THE CANDY BAR. Beautiful plating and balance of chocolates, caramels and peanut butter. Perfect to share for 2 or 3, or have it to yourself if your'e brave enough.  Eleven is a great experience for a sit down meal, or bar vibe. I will be eating here a 3rd, if not 4th time in the future!

photos.caption: Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The Candy Bar. Holy hell. Chocolate heaven with peanut butter and caramel accents
Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sword fish and arugula. Note the cosmo on the right. They did not go light on the alcohol in this mix
Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Red Snapper with assorted root vegetables, mushrooms and potato gnocchi. Gnocchi reminded us more more of a potato casserole.

Ook1KK7HoZ9h_b0WDB17KQ.text: Eleven was our first dinner experience in the city, and for us, truly is as good as it gets!  The interior decor is classy yet not overly stuffy, and the lighting is flattering to everyone and everything.  As requested, we sat in a booth on the first floor.  There is a second floor that completely opens up to create an "open air" space weather permitting, but the weather was not permitting on the night of our visit.    For cocktails, my husband chose a scotch, and I chose a French Pinot Noir.  Much to my delight, the Pinot Noir was a generous pour, and I did not have to order a second.  As starters, I chose Ricotta Cavatelli (blistered cherry tomatoes, garlic, basil, burrata and tiny pasta) and my husband had the gazpacho.  Both were very good, but mine was the best!  We also enjoyed their bread basket with my favorite being the raisin pecan bread.  The entrees were Lamb Loin for me, and Beef Tendeloin for him.  They were fabulous as well as the other accompanying items--take a look at their menu.  I cannot do it justice, other than to say I wanted to lick all my plates clean!  Although we had more than enough food, we had to keep the winning streak going and try dessert.  My husband ordered banana dream, I mean cream pie, and I ordered the trio of sorbets.  The pie looked like a dream pie, and had I not eaten so much, I would have wanted my own piece.  My sorbets were flavored watermelon-strawberry, cocunut-lime, and passion fruit served with a side of fresh berries and 3 small delicious cookies.  This was the best sorbet I have ever tasted.  Flavors were on the sweet-sour side, and reminded me of margaritas, sans tequila.  And we both had a shot of their house made limoncello --totally hit the spot!    Service is excellent, and their timing is down to a science.  Our server was quite attentive yet not intrusive. Never did we not have a new set of clean silverware for each course, and there were plenty of bread basket visits, and drinks filled.  Wish we were in town longer as I definitely would like to come back for happy hours and to dine on the second floor open air style.

photos.caption: Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pinot Noir
Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Ricotta Cavatelli
Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Banana Dream Pie

hBc1LIkXBuEbTzz_AZGccw.text: I don't think Eleven dabbles much in gastronomy nor is it constrained by the walls of classical cuisines. It serves fresh, tasty, and refreshing modern American fare. This is what I want 'American' cuisine to taste like.  The dishes we had were all superbly executed - cheeseboard, steak tartare, swordfish with forbidden rice risotto, ricotta cavatelli, 'Candy Bar' desert. Truly enjoyable from start to finish. Oh, the in-house breads (semolina, cranberry and focaccia) were as good as the dishes. The atmosphere was amazing and the service on point.  Food: 5 Atmosphere/Service: 5 Value: 5 - somewhat pricey for Pittsburgh Overall: 5

FoyXxtjmVr2VncZkKglKIw.text: 700 arch street, Pittsburgh, Pa 15212. I've been here a number of times two or three in total. The service is always good the food is always fresh and the drinks are well-made. It definitely warrants the price? it would be five stars, however, they need to tweak a few things to justify the high-end five star prices. Overall it's a solid 4.25 stars.

m7AEZjMHtBTeR3446X0PJw.text: A great evening at Eleven. Great ambiance and bar. It's nice to have a coat check and valet parking. Our meals were great I had pasta with crab and it was light not a heavy sauce at all. The service was excellent attentive but not over bearing. We were seated where there were tables for two in a row and I didn't feel like we were on top of the tables next to us. The noise level was good too. The menu was varied too, it seems like so many pgh restaurants are meat heavy lately ...many great options at Eleven

DUeqdXdyuFNwiHwgbleRVg.text: Excellent food and atmosphere as always.  The service was very good but not excellent.   Hostess was unethesustic.  Bread service was inattentive.  Definitely would be back.  Hoping for an excellent 5 star experience next time.

3MknxmotBeHnxON2oAkvjg.text: We went here for my girlfriend's birthday dinner with a few of our friends. The service and food was absolutely impeccable. The servers were attentive, but knew that we wanted to space out our courses. For a party of 8, we were there for two hours and enjoyed ourselves throughly. The food came out quick. The bread service was amazing, especially the focaccia. It should be on the table. Can't wait to take her back.

GrHCQtwJIz_DTB-ZxznBeg.text: We had a bad experience.  Why would anyone go back and pay so much money. Everything was slow. Food came out cold after apologizing 3 times for delay. Waiter was very nice though seemed a bit lost.    Then at end, it took 20 minutes for them to check us out kept saying there was a problem their machine.   A few successes - Appetizers were very good, bread was excellent.

0THTp6kZqlgwPNv09HPEnA.text: My son and daughter decided to take me here for my Mother's day dinner. They offer valet parking for $5.00 but my son showed me on Penn Ave you can park your car for free after 6 pm and we were only a couple of blocks away!  We were seated immediately upstairs with a view overlooking the bar. Eleven does have an outdoor patio as well as Tavern downstairs with a separate menu. Dress is business casual.  We had a new waitress serve us and she did an excellent job. We learned that we could "swap out" the sides that came with our entrees. With that in mind I ordered the wild Alaskan halibut but chose the sides that came with seared salmon entree. My son also ordered the halibut and my daughter opted for the roasted chicken.  We were given a choice of three different types of bread prior to our meal. Our waitress was very attentive to our needs and made sure our waters were filled as well as any other beverages we ordered.  The main entrees are generally small but there is enough with the sides to give you a delicious meal. All meals were pretty well seasoned but very good. We each decided to opt for a different dessert. I had the banana cream pie. It came with banana slices on it as well as cookies and caramel slices.  My son had the ice cream sandwich that had real cheesecake in it. My daughter had the chocolate cake which came with peppermint ice cream and chocolate candy.  We were given peanut butter crunch truffles with our check. Service and food were excellent. This place is pricey however, I do not mind paying a bit extra now and then when a special occasion warrants it.  Eleven is open for lunch during weekdays only but open for dinner nightly starting at 5. This is truly one place we will visit again when the occasion warrants it.

photos.caption: Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Banana cream pie
Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Warm dark chocolate cake
Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Brown sugar ice cream sandwich

v8FgAQ5CpyItFJ5qX3n3TA.text: Wish I could say I loved his place.  We ordered  fish and lamb dishes.  Both dishes had too many competing flavors to really taste the fish or lamb.  The tomato soup was ordinary.  Nothing to recommend here.  Dishes are large so pace yourself.  We sat outside and had a nice view of the convention center and skyline.  Given the fact that the weather was perfect, we enjoyed ourselves.

nBHDNYOnpLdbIX_Ocn3KFw.text: We loved it!  Scallop appetizer had a delicious reduction. Three Greens Salad was served on top of a divine red pepper goat cheese paste.  Swordfish entree was a combination of amazing flavors and textures. Candy Bar dessert left me wishing my stomach was bigger so I could order a second one.  Our experience was complete perfection.

gIVOO7tf72PeOJvxY6_8bg.text: Loved it!!  Our server Brian was super helpful, and knew the menu.  He offered suggestions and helped us with places around town.  He even wrote different places for us to go.  Thanks for the help.  Oh, and the food was amazing too. Loved the duck. Yummo

QmkNdtj9zVwaicuDNZ7nUw.text: I dined here while in town over Christmas.  My husband and I took his mom out for dinner to celebrate her 80th birthday.  The setting and ambiance was really nice and our service was over the top fantastic.  Water glasses were always full, the servers provided tons of helpful recommendations and were so friendly without being overly present - it was the perfect balance.  Our food was all expertly prepared and we loved every dish we ordered.  My salmon was perfectly cooked and my mother in law absolutely loved her pappardelle.  Thank you Eleven for making our dining experience so wonderful!

o4dPrs8_xfZsnyJMPCfjRw.text: Eleven is one of our favorite restaurants in Pittsburgh and for me, the best restaurant owned by Big Burrito Group.  They have a bread basket with several types of homemade bread, made in house - a great way to start off the meal and the experience.  The decor and low lighting make sense here and the food is fantastic.  The hanger steak is a personal fave.  The restaurant does border on expensive for Pittsburgh, but it's worth it for special occasions or if you have guests in town.

FlJG371gDimhNaNLZtQ49g.text: A spur of the moment trip to Eleven turned into one of the best meals we've had in Pittsburgh.   I've heard of Eleven in passing and have read a few reviews on Yelp, but we'd never made our way down there until last night. Glad we did!  I had a reservation for 6:45 and we were promptly seated, we sat on the second level. I myself really enjoyed the conversion from warehouse to restaurant. The work done in the building is exceptional in and of itself.  We both looked over the drink menu, I opted for a Victory Festbier and she opted for the Starry Night cocktail. While I myself am not a fan of cocktails, I sampled the Starry Night and it was exceptional, the garnish of sage absolutely put it over the top. I could smell it from across the table.  Being as we'd never been, we of course had to try a little bit of everything. We ordered 3 cheeses to start; Uplands Pleasant Ridge Reserve, Chickabiddy and the Goldette Tommette. The cheese plate was served with breads, honeycomb, walnuts(a few were a little bitter due to over roasting) a cracker of some variety and an unidentifiable delicious jam.  Next I opted to have the Three Green Salad. Initially at first I wasn't enjoying it, it required a bit more vinegar in the vinaigrette. However once I discovered the red pepper goat cheese on the bottom of the plate along with the caper berries it all came together. She had the Sweet Potato Puree which was delicious. I don't like sweet potato but upon trying it..maybe I do! I'd also like to point out that the Sweet Potato Puree was piping hot.   Entree time. She opted for the Seafood Tasting and I the Elysian Field Lamb Loin. Our food arrived promptly and was very hot. The plates of food were both very attractive to look at and the plating was nice. My lamb was cooked perfectly medium rare. Seasoned adequately. The side with the patty pan squash, the wax beans, green beans and the Israeli couscous was very nice. I liked the peppery seasoning which the sides had. The raisins and pickeled onions just put it over the top.  She enjoyed the Seafood Tasting however made a point that the crab cake was mediocre at best. However, the scallop and the halibut were very good. The halibut was cooked perfectly. The sides which accompanied the seafood tasting were nice as well.   For dessert I had the Cashew Blondie Sundae and and she had the Blueberry Pie. The cashew brittle on the sundae was absolutely awesome. Crunchy, sweet and salty at the same time. The blueberries in the blueberry pie tasted as if they'd been picked yesterday. Very fresh tasting.   The entire experience was excellent. Great food, great service and a great environment.

photos.caption: Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cashew Blondie Sundae
Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Blueberry Pie - The Lemon Ice Cream was incredibly refreshing.
Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Elysian Fields Lamb Loin - Absolutely exceptional.

9xTL9A1G1RzwCb2i71I14Q.text: I went here for graduation dinner with my family. Service was great and every dish was incredible. I got the beef tenderloin with gnocchi, mushrooms, and blue cheese (pictured), but everyone's favorite dish was surprisingly the pork chop with polenta. When I didn't order a dessert, our server brought out a complimentary banana cream pie with "congratulations" written on it which was very much appreciated! Not much else to say, it was a wonderful experience and I'll definitely be dining here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Ym7CKN77w_9JakJRnEgHJw.text: Probably my favorite restaurant in downtown Pittsburgh. While the food is expensive, it is definitely worth the money. The service is incredible. Everyone is knowledgeable about the menu, and it seems like they have a different person tending to you for each item served. I ordered the swordfish, which was delicious. My girlfriend and I also ordered oysters for an appetizer and they were the freshest, most real piece of seafood we had ever tasted. It is almost like they had just taken them out of the ocean and put them directly on our plates. The sauces served with them were also savory. If you don't mind spending some extra money for high quality dishes, and are looking for a pleasant, different eating experience then this place should be at the top of your list.

ix5Hv8khaKPRBvKHEXYUcQ.text: I don't know how anyone gives this place less than five stars! I have eaten here three times, and every cocktail, glass of wine, appetizer, entree and dessert has been positively memorable. I wen there in a party of 7 for my son's college graduation dinner. Every single person raved about every dish and nearly every drink. My blood orange Negroni was perfect. My morels appetizer was amazing, my halibut entree was fabulous, and the coconut tres leches cake was even better! I've eaten at a lot of restaurants in Pittsburgh, but I think Eleven is the best!!!

qzWx1nsNrPWRSps_L0YXGQ.text: Sat at the bar with some friends and enjoyed great food, friendly staff, and wonderful wine list. The location is convenient and the atmosphere is intimate, yet lively.

K3M9OZjNMQ-F0jUQSu7nHQ.text: Had a really wonderful meal here. Sat at the bar and had a great conversation with the bar staff. Place is spacious and has multiple seating situations, which is great for different groups. High tops, banquettes, bar area. Super friendly, informative and pleasant servers to be around.   I had the Hanger steak, with rosemary horseradish potato croquette, roasted cauliflower, glazed shallots, greens and Madeira jus.

photos.caption: Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Hanger steak, with rosemary horseradish potato croquette, roasted cauliflower, glazed shallots, greens and Madeira jus.

4izjqJFx5NkfxZl55tcHcQ.text: This past Sunday I took my mother here for brunch and we had an amazing time! Eleven's Prix Fixe menu included an appetizer, an entree, and a free cocktail or juice for $29. While we waited we enjoyed croissants, cornmeal muffins and biscuits with honey butter and pineapple jam that was utterly fantastic! I ordered the beignets that were served with a raspberry compote topped with granola and glaze, the polenta waffles that came served with *the* most amazing peppered bacon, and their sangria cocktail. The beignets were amazing and the waffles were very nice, if not a bit sweet (although, that was my bad for ordering two sweet dishes in a row *can't wait to go back and try the salmon salad*). My mother ordered the pistachio sticky bun and the prosciutto omelet breakfast that came served with potatoes and that peppered bacon again. Both dishes I tried (with or without permission) and both were delicious! My only gripe would be the cocktails. My sangria and my mother's mimosa were both made with *very* dry wines - not our bag, but definitely not a deal breaker. Out of everything, what we enjoyed most were the portions. While the food was lovely it wasn't sparse, proving that fine dining can be beautiful, delicious, *and* filling! After seeing the value of Eleven's brunch menu, both my mother and myself are eager to return for dinner!

bSwwHlsLUonMmjCsuRi7tQ.text: Came in for brunch - $29 for an appetizer, entree, and cocktail of your choice, which is an amazing deal for the quality and quantity of food and service.  I got the oysters (you get six pieces), proscuitto omelette, and maple smash.  With the oysters, you get this awesome hot sauce, which I asked for on the side with my omelette since it was so good.  With the proscuitto omelet, you get a side of either bacon or sausage.  For their cocktails, they use top shelf liquor, bulleit for the maple smash.  Excellent brunch spot and I hear dinner here is great as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Proscuitto omelette
Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Oyster appetizer
Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Assortment of bread and butter/spread

foTNG8DQddAmwLcAl9a6iA.text: Eleven-- you are so extra, but I love you so. Out of all the new American places in Pittsburgh, Eleven is consistently the one I want to go to for all special occasions.   There's valet parking in the front. The restaurant inside always makes me feel like I'm in the Great Gatsby era--it's dark and there are amazing lights and the seats are so plush. But the real standout, and the reason I keep coming back is the food. Everything that I've had, from seafood, to steak, to pork chops, has been amazing. They also circle the tables with different bread options that are to die for.   The desserts are good too! Everything is good. Go make a reservation now.

photos.caption: Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

mDxmzRtoUzC1tNubQfLx-A.text: I went here with some friends for Happy Hour before attending a concert downtown. When we first walked in, we had plethora choices to sit and dine. The couches, bar, and high-top tables were all open. I had two of the sangrias on the happy hour menu; not only were they delicious but they were beautiful! I also decided to try the calamari which was super tasty. I'm usually not one to get calamari, but when I return, I will definitely get it again. I paid just $7 for the calamari and each of my drinks. One of my friends tried the Soft Pretzels, and the other ordered the Blue Bay Mussels which both ended with clean plates/bowls. I love the calm and chic atmosphere this restaurant provides. I'm excited to return bringing more people and trying different dishes on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Happy Hour Sangria $7

XSUO806CBUdwxRR30p0gjQ.text: Eleven was finally the first restaurant through my Pittsburg adventure with a quieter setting. We thought we'd splurge a little on our last meal yet it was still pretty affordable.   Food: the food was definitely more elevated than the few other spots we hit up while on our trip. For $30 we got an appetizer, entree and a drink. We started with the Eleven Mule which was cucumber vodka and some ginger beer, very refreshing. They gave us a basket with assorted baked starters which was a little bit on the dry side. When the main course came it was definitely delicious and the perfect portion. The breakfast sandwich (which I asked to be all separated) was delicious, especially the bacon!   Service: We asked for everything to be served at once and boy did it come at an incredible speed. Waiters were all very nice   Atmosphere: Finally a place where we could just have a normal conversation without screaming. I mean with the decor and vibe of the place you definitely wouldn't find the louder crowd here. I'd recommend this for brunch, a nice business meal or romantic dinner for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Eleven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
